0.title: ANPR cameras help B'luru Traffic Police collect ₹21 cr in fines
0.article_body: In Bengaluru, Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) cameras helped traffic police track down violators in 3.9 lakh active cases and collect fines worth over ₹21 crore from them till July 19. The cameras were installed on March 1 at several crossings, most of them near the Central Business District. ANPR cameras helped in collection of fines in 2,765 cases daily.

1.title: 11 arrested for gambling after raid on TDP leader's house in Hyd
1.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday reportedly raided the house of Andhra Pradesh TDP leader Ravi Kumar Varma in the city and arrested 11 persons for gambling. Varma himself was not arrested as he was not playing cards, reports suggest. Police reportedly seized cash worth ₹19.5 lakhs. It is learned that those arrested include realtors and businessmen from Hyderabad and Andhra Pradesh.

2.title: Traffic advisory issued in Delhi ahead of Prez-elect's swearing-in ceremony
2.article_body: Vehicular movement is likely to be affected in Lutyens' Delhi on Monday due to President-elect Droupadi Murmu's swearing-in ceremony, Delhi Traffic Police said. Commuters have been asked to avoid Teen Murti Marg, Akbar Road, Krishna Menon Marg and Maulana Azad Road, among others, between 9:00 am and 12 noon. New Parliament building's construction will also be stopped during this time.

3.title: BBMP chief inspects development works at Silk Board Junction
3.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath on Saturday inspected the ongoing development works at the Silk Board Junction where BMRCL is fixing a bus stop. He instructed officials to direct the flow of water to nearby drains to avoid stagnation. He further asked officials to speed up the taring process to ease traffic congestion.

4.title: 3, including ex-mayor, killed in shooting at Philippine university
4.article_body: At least three people were killed in a shooting at the Ateneo de Manila University in the Philippines' Manila on Sunday, police said. The deceased include a former mayor, Rose Furigay, from the country's southern province of Basilan, who was at the university premises to attend her daughter's graduation ceremony. The incident appears to be a targeted assassination, officials said.

5.title: Chess-playing robot breaks 7-yr-old's finger at Russian tournament, video surfaces
5.article_body: A chess-playing robot broke the index finger of a seven-year-old boy who was competing at the Moscow Chess Open Tournament. A video of the incident, which took place on July 19, has also surfaced online. The robot reportedly attacked the child named Christopher after he played a move without waiting his turn, after which bystanders rushed to rescue him.

6.title: Before-after satellite pics show impact of record-breaking heatwave on UK
6.article_body: Satellite images captured by NASA show the impact record-breaking heatwave has had on the UK. In comparison to a green landscape from a year ago, the images now show the country looking dried out and brown. Earlier this week, the temperatures reached 40°C for the first time in the UK.

7.title: Portraits of PM Modi, UP CM Adityanath found in garbage at power plant
7.article_body: Portraits of PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath were found in garbage collected at Kosi Kalan power plant, officials said. Some employees of the power plant disposed of the portraits while the office was being cleaned, officials added. Recently, a sanitation worker was terminated after photos of PM Modi and Adityanath were found in his garbage cart.

8.title: 4 killed, 4 injured after car fell into gorge in J&K's Ramban
8.article_body: Four people were killed and four others got injured after a car skidded off the road and fell into a 1,000 feet deep gorge in the Ramban district, Jammu and Kashmir. The deceased were identified as Haza Begum, Abdul Rasheed, Mushtaq Ahmed and Zahida Begum, officials said. All four deceased were locals and were going from Neel to Shagan village.

9.title: Delhi man gets fake link to activate credit card, loses ₹3.5 lakh
9.article_body: At least five persons have been arrested for allegedly cheating a man in Delhi by sending him a fake link on pretext of activating his credit card. One of the accused posed as a customer care executive of a bank and contacted man. The man allegedly lost amount as soon as he filled in requested details after clicking on link.

10.title: Man dresses up as 'Yamaraja' to protest against bad roads in B'luru
10.article_body: A man dressed up as 'Yamaraja' on the Anjanapura road in Bengaluru to protest against potholed roads in the city. The man, associated with the Changemakers of Kanakapura Road, alleged that officials have been ignoring the roads of Anjanapura for more than 10 years. The organisation said these damaged roads have become a deathtrap for the daily commuters.

11.title: Irani sends legal notice to Congress leaders for claiming her daughter ran 'illegal bar'
11.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Sunday sent legal notices to the Congress party and three of its leaders over their allegations against her 18-year-old daughter Zoish. Pawan Khera, Jairam Ramesh and Netta D'Souza received notices from Irani who refuted claims that her daughter ran an "illegal bar" in Goa. She sought a written unconditional apology and withdrawal of allegations.

12.title: You are a true champion: President Kovind to Neeraj on winning silver
12.article_body: Praising javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra after he won India's first-ever silver medal at World Athletics Championships, President Ram Nath Kovind tweeted, "Neeraj continues to bring laurels and make the country proud...you're a true champion!" BCCI Secretary Jay Shah tweeted, "Congratulations Neeraj...you are writing a new course of history for Indian athletics, while inspiring millions!"

13.title: PWP workers protest outside CIDCO over inadequate water in Navi Mumbai
13.article_body: Workers of Peasants and Workers Party (PWP) staged a protest outside the City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO) office in Navi Mumbai's Kamothe over inadequate water supply. The workers also put a garland of shoes on CIDCO's water department notice board. "There is good rain everywhere [but] citizens have to bear water shortage in Kamothe," said city president Amol Shitole.

14.title: Sun Pharma, Glenmark recall products in US over manufacturing issues
14.article_body: Mumbai-headquartered drug makers Sun Pharma and Glenmark are recalling products in the US due to lapses in their manufacturing processes, as per a latest enforcement report by US Food and Drug Administration. The report states that Sun Pharma is recalling 50,680 vials of Testosterone Cypionate Injection and Glenmark is recalling 98,307 packs of a medication used for treating skin conditions.

15.title: Will give my best in CWG: Neeraj after historic silver win at World C'ships
15.article_body: Neeraj Chopra said he will give his best in the upcoming Commonwealth Games in Birmingham after becoming the second Indian and first male track and field athlete to win a medal at World Athletics Championships. Neeraj threw the javelin at a distance of 88.13 metres in his fourth attempt to win India's first-ever silver medal in the tournament.

16.title: MP records highest tiger deaths this year, Maharashtra on second
16.article_body: As many as 27 tigers died in Madhya Pradesh this year till July 15, which is the highest number of tiger deaths reported by an Indian state, according to National Tiger Conservation Authority's (NTCA) data. Total 74 tiger deaths were registered in the country during the period, as per the data. Maharashtra reported 15 tiger deaths, which is the second-highest.

17.title: Results of ISC Class 12 exams 2022 declared
17.article_body: The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) has announced the results of ISC Class 12 exams 2022. Students who appeared for the exams can check results at the official website www.cisce.org or through SMS. Schools can check the results by logging in to the CAREERS portal of the council using the school principal's login ID and password.

18.title: Introspection needed by media: Anurag Thakur after CJI's remark
18.article_body: After CJI NV Ramana said media is running "kangaroo courts", Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday called for introspection by media houses. "We need to introspect whether we have crossed the 'Lakshman Rekha' while delivering news," Thakur added. "I wish to urge friends in media that if such an impression is being created, there's a need for introspection," he stated.

19.title: Can't sit back & say we don't have numbers: Oppn VP candidate Alva
19.article_body: Opposition's Vice Presidential candidate Margaret Alva has said that while there's disunity among non-BJP parties over her nomination, she doesn't feel perturbed as the final tally of votes can always swing. "We can't just sit back and say we don't have the numbers, so we won't fight...election," she added. TMC has decided to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential elections.

20.title: Gang from Madhya Pradesh held for sandalwood theft in Pune
20.article_body: A gang has been nabbed from Madhya Pradesh for its alleged involvement in sandalwood theft at several places in Pune. Four members of the gang were arrested during an investigation into the series of sandalwood theft at sensitive locations in Khadki. They were allegedly planning to commit a robbery, police said.

21.title: FPIs invest net ₹1,099 cr from July 1-22, break 9-month selling streak
21.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) invested net ₹1,099 crore in Indian equities between July 1-22 and broke their nine-month long selling streak, data with depositories showed. This comes after FPIs withdrew net ₹50,145 crore from equities in June, the highest net outflow since March 2020. So far this year, FPIs have pulled out around ₹2.16 lakh crore from equities.

22.title: Happy for Peters for winning gold, I'm happy with the rivalry: Neeraj Chopra
22.article_body: Praising Grenada's Anderson Peters, who won gold in the men's javelin event at the World Athletics Championships 2022, Neeraj Chopra said he's happy to have "healthy competition". "Peters is doing well, he's thrown more than 90m quite a few times this year. It's good for the sport. I'm happy with the rivalry," he added. Neeraj secured silver in the event.

23.title: Uzbek girls trafficked on bikes from Nepal: Delhi Police on prostitution racket
23.article_body: The Delhi Police, which busted a prostitution racket in South Delhi's Malviya Nagar area run by foreigners, found that the gang trafficked girls from Uzbekistan and neighbouring countries illegally on bikes across the Nepal-India border. "Most of the girls...were first brought to Nepal by flight...Then they used to cross the border wearing a burqa," the police said.

24.title: 2 teenagers drown in pond in village near Jaipur; 3 others rescued
24.article_body: Two teenagers drowned while taking bath in a pond in Aakda village located on the outskirts of Jaipur, Rajasthan. The two deceased, Rohit Bunkar (14) and Manish Gupta (14), drowned while three others were rescued by the locals, a sub-inspector of the Daulatpura police station said. Notably, the deceased were residents of the nearby Vishwakarma Industrial Area, he added.

25.title: 6 killed as house collapses after firecracker explosion in Bihar; many feared trapped
25.article_body: At least six people died after a house where an illegal firecracker unit was being run collapsed due to a blast in Bihar's Chapra on Sunday, police said. Efforts are being made to rescue people trapped under the debris. "We're investigating the reason behind the explosion. A forensic team and bomb disposal squads have also been called," he added.

26.title: Had a health issue where I couldn't move my right hand at all: Bhagyashree
26.article_body: Bhagyashree revealed that there was a time in her life when she couldn't move her right hand "at all". "I'd a major health issue...I went through immense pain," she said, adding, "That one year...I couldn't even brush...teeth or comb...hair." "Now when I think of those days when I fought to get my hand back to movement, I...get inspired," said Bhagyashree.

27.title: Can't guarantee we'll be ready in 2 weeks: Chelsea manager Tuchel
27.article_body: Following their 4-0 defeat against Arsenal in their pre-season game, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said he can't guarantee that they'll be ready for their Premier League opener against Everton on August 6. "I don't know if I ever lost 4-0 in pre-season," stated Tuchel. Chelsea also lost to Major League Soccer team Charlotte FC in their previous pre-season friendly.

28.title: I feel for Shreyas Iyer, we used to talk about him as future captain: Ajay Jadeja
28.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said he feels for Shreyas Iyer, who "walked into the team with so much promise". "A year ago we would be talking about him as the future captain...suddenly, he [starts getting] out to short balls...[and] that's playing so much on his mind that you saw that in [his] innings [against West Indies]," stated Jadeja.

29.title: 30 injured as bus turns on its side in Maharashtra's Solapur
29.article_body: A Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation bus carrying 42 passengers turned on its side after hitting the roadside curb in Maharashtra's Solapur on Sunday. Around 30 passengers sustained injuries ranging from minor to fractures and are receiving treatment, officials said. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde announced ₹50,000 aid from CM Relief Fund to those who sustained specific serious injuries.

30.title: Akshay Kumar receives 'Taxpayers Award' from govt, pic surfaces
30.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has received 'Taxpayers Award' from the government in recognition of his contribution towards nation building. A picture of the award has surfaced online. "He has the maximum number of films today and he is ruling the endorsement world. It's no surprise for him to feature in the highest tax payer list of India," a source told Pinkvilla.

31.title: Spoke to Pak's Arshad after World Championships, told him he did very well: Neeraj
31.article_body: Javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said he spoke to his competitor, Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem, after the end of the World Athletics Championships in which Chopra won a silver medal. "I told him (Nadeem) that he did very well. He replied that he had issues with his elbow," said 24-year-old Chopra, adding, "It was a great comeback from his injury."

32.title: Felt something on thigh after silver-winning throw, will know the status tomorrow: Neeraj
32.article_body: Javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, who became the first Indian to win a silver medal at the World Athletics Championships, revealed that he felt something on his thigh after his silver-winning 88.13-metre throw in the fourth attempt. "I couldn't do my best in next two [attempts]. I had strapping [on my thigh]. I will know the status tomorrow morning," he stated.

33.title: DGCA begins special audit of airlines after surge in technical issues
33.article_body: The DGCA has started a two-month-long special audit of airlines after several technical malfunction incidents took place in planes during the last 45 days. The audit will focus on facilities like hangars, equipment being used by airline personnel, airlines' quality assurance system, duty time limitations and airlines' maintenance control centre, among others.

34.title: I don't always invest to make money, sometimes it's to help someone: Mark Cuban
34.article_body: Billionaire investor and Shark Tank judge Mark Cuban said that he doesn't do the TV show to "get the best investments". He tweeted, "I don't always invest because I think I'll make money. Sometimes my deals are purely to help someone." Cuban recently revealed that he has not profited from the investments made on the show, saying, "I've gotten beat."

35.title: Doesn't make sense to call me South actor, we're actors from India: Dhanush
35.article_body: National Award-winning actor Dhanush has said people should not attach regional identities to actors. "Every film is for everybody, especially with the digital platforms. Now everybody has easy access to watch everybody's work," he added. "So, it just doesn't make sense in these times to call me or anybody else a South actor. We're just actors from India," said Dhanush.

36.title: Keep winning medals for India like this: Bajrang on Neeraj's Worlds silver
36.article_body: Congratulating Neeraj Chopra on his silver medal in men's javelin throw at World Championships in Oregon, wrestler Bajrang Punia took to Twitter and wrote, "Brother...you keep winning medals for the country like this. This is a prayer to god." Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Unstoppable in every sense of the word, well done Neeraj! Keep scripting history with...javelin in your hand!"

37.title: This is harassment: DK Shivakumar on ED summon to Sonia Gandhi
37.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar said ED has summoned party’s interim chief Sonia Gandhi which was "unnecessary". "After fifty hours of interrogation of Rahul Gandhi, the ED has now summoned Sonia Gandhi…This is harassment. We would be observing a peaceful protest on the 26th [July]," he added. ED has issued fresh summon to Sonia Gandhi for July 26, reports stated.

38.title: This is not our road: Arjun Kapoor to paparazzi clicking pics on road
38.article_body: A video going viral shows actor Arjun Kapoor asking paparazzi clicking his pictures on the road to move inside. He can be heard saying, "Humari road nahi hai yeh. Aap log yeh karte ho aur naam humara kharab hota hai...Kisi ko lag jayegi (This is not our road. You guys do such things and we get blamed...Someone will get hurt)."

39.title: Where does WB govt want to take youth of state?: Pradhan on Partha's arrest
39.article_body: Following the arrest of West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan asked, "Where does the state government want to take the youth of Bengal?" Furthermore, he said, "₹21 crore cash was found at his residence. He is arrested and he is a minister, this shows the condition of Bengal today. This is a serious matter."

40.title: One of the reasons for our success is my 12-yr market experience: Zerodha CEO
40.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath said one of the reasons for the success of his firm is his 12-year experience in the stock market before starting the stock brokerage platform. Sharing advice for budding entrepreneurs, Kamath said that before building a business, they must find a skill they're competent in, learn it and get good at it and then monetise it.

41.title: PMC issues 758 notices to buildings in July over mosquito breeding
41.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has issued 758 notices to buildings in the city over mosquito breeding grounds, which may lead to a surge in dengue and chikungunya cases. "PMC has issued notification to the public to check [for] stagnant water around residential [and] commercial complexes," an official said. Pune has reported 50 new dengue cases this month so far.

42.title: Nehru's intentions could be good but same doesn't apply to policies: Rajnath
42.article_body: During an event to pay homage to the martyrs of the 1999 Kargil War, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh commented on the 1962 India-China War when Jawaharlal Nehru was India's Prime Minister. "In 1962, China captured our area in Ladakh. I will not question  Nehru's intentions. It can be good but the same does not apply to policies," Rajnath said.

43.title: Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal's salary falls nearly 5% to ₹15.39 crore in FY22
43.article_body: Bharti Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal's salary fell nearly 5% in the financial year 2021-22 to ₹15.39 crore. In the year 2020-21, Mittal's gross remuneration stood at ₹16.19 crore. In 2021-22, Mittal's perquisites stood at ₹83 lakh, against ₹1.62 crore in the previous fiscal. Meanwhile, Bharti Airtel MD Gopal Vittal's salary rose 5.8% in FY22 to ₹15.25 crore.

44.title: US women pull off upset, beat Jamaican team to win 4x100 relay at World C'ships
44.article_body: US women's team pulled an upset over the Jamaican team to secure the gold medal in the 4x100m relay at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon. The Jamaican team, which included both the world 100m and 200m champions, finished a close second in 41.18 seconds. The US team clocked 41.14 seconds, the fifth-fastest in history, to win the gold.

45.title: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess to step down, Porsche CEO to succeed him
45.article_body: Herbert Diess, the Volkswagen CEO who was caught up in the automaker's emissions-cheating scandal, will step down "by mutual consent" on September 1, Volkswagen announced on Friday. He'll be succeeded by Porsche CEO Oliver Blume, who'll retain his current position too. Diess had earlier reportedly clashed with Volkswagen's labour representatives over issues including top personnel decisions.

46.title: Agnipath recruitment exam for IAF conducted amid tight security
46.article_body: The Agnipath recruitment exam for the Indian Air Force began on Sunday in various cities across India, including Kanpur, Patna and Delhi, amid tight security. Police personnel along with Air Force personnel were deployed across various examination centres. Constant surveillance of examination centres was also carried out. The exam will be conducted from July 24 to July 31.

47.title: Was not called for 'Baahubali 2', don't want to question it at all: Sudeep
47.article_body: Kiccha Sudeep, who was a part of 'Baahubali: The Beginning', said he was "not called" to reprise his role in the sequel 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'. "I don't want to question it at all," he added. "I don't think...I missed being in...second part," said Sudeep, who played the role of Aslaam Khan, an Arabian weapon dealer in the first part.

48.title: Dil se shukriya: Vicky Kaushal celebrates 7 years of 'Masaan'
48.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post on the seventh anniversary of his film 'Masaan'. Sharing a few stills from the film, he wrote, "7 saal ho gaye! Dil se shukriya. #Masaan (It's been seven years. A heartfelt gratitude)." Directed by Neeraj Ghaywan, 'Masaan' also featured Richa Chadha, Sanjay Mishra and Pankaj Tripathi.

49.title: My character in 'Liger' stammers, I struggled for first 3 days: Vijay
49.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said his character in 'Liger' has a stammering problem which according to him, made it more interesting. "It added both subtle humour and an emotional layer to [my] character...when we started shooting, I was struggling to get the right note, but after three days, everything was easy," he added. Ananya Panday also features in the film.

50.title: Krunal Pandya, wife Pankhuri blessed with a baby boy, share pics
50.article_body: Cricketer Krunal Pandya and his wife Pankhuri have been blessed with a baby boy. The duo took to their Instagram accounts to share pictures with their first child. They have named their baby boy 'Kavir Krunal Pandya'. Krunal's brother Hardik reacted to Krunal's post by sharing heart emojis. Several other cricketers, including KL Rahul, congratulated the couple.

51.title: Nathan Lyon marries real estate agent Emma after 5 years of dating, shares pic
51.article_body: Australia off-spinner Nathan Lyon tied the knot with real estate agent Emma McCarthy after five years of dating. Sharing a picture on Instagram, he wrote, "Mr & Mrs." Several cricketers, including Brett Lee, Peter Siddle and Alex Carey, congratulated the couple. In December 2020, the couple had bought their first house together worth $2.6 million in Tennyson Point.

52.title: Woman gives birth on road after being hit by truck in UP, dies minutes later
52.article_body: An eight-month pregnant woman gave birth to her daughter on a road after being hit by a truck in UP's Agra but died soon after. The incident occurred on Wednesday (July 20) when the woman's husband lost control of the motorbike they were on. The 26-year-old victim went into labour and delivered a healthy baby girl, minutes before succumbing.

53.title: 26-year-old kabaddi player bludgeoned to death with cricket stump in Mumbai; 3 arrested
53.article_body: A 26-year-old kabaddi player was bludgeoned to death with a cricket stump on the intervening night of Friday and Saturday in Mumbai's Dharavi, reported ANI. Three accused have been arrested in the case so far. Meanwhile, a group of locals gathered outside the Dharavi Police Station on Sunday to demand the arrest of all the accused in the murder case.

54.title: No need to panic, situation under control: CM as Delhi reports 1st monkeypox case
54.article_body: As Delhi reported its first case of monkeypox infection, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said there is no need to panic and the situation is under control. "We have made a separate isolation ward at LNJP. Our best team is on the case to prevent the spread and protect Delhiites," he said. The 31-year-old patient has no history of foreign travel.

55.title: Aditya cast me in 'Uri...' when I was being typecast by B'wood: Yami
55.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has revealed that her husband and filmmaker Aditya Dhar had cast her in a different role in 'Uri: The Surgical Strike' when she was offered certain types of roles. "That same year (2019), 'Bala' happened. So he's someone who has a mind like that and he will never go the cliche way," she said speaking about Aditya.

56.title: Selectors will be tempted to have Dhawan in Team India till 2023 WC: Rajkumar
56.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said selectors will be 100% tempted to have Shikhar Dhawan in the Indian team till 2023 World Cup at least. "He has exceptional stats in white-ball cricket, especially if you see his record in ODI cricket, it's extremely fantastic," he added. Dhawan scored 97 in India's three-run win against West Indies in first ODI.

57.title: Tamil Nadu most 'atrocity prone' state for Dalits and STs: Govt data
57.article_body: Tamil Nadu has been identified as the state where most Dalits and Scheduled Tribes (STs) are subjected to various kinds of violence, according to Ministry of Home Affairs' data. As many as 345 villages in 37 districts of Tamil Nadu have been identified as 'atrocity prone', the data stated. In Chhattisgarh 101 villages are 'atrocity prone', as per the data.

58.title: Entrance tests for Class 10, 12 in Delhi govt schools to be held on July 25
58.article_body: Entrance tests for seats in Class 10 and 12 in Delhi's government schools will be conducted on Monday (July 25) and the results will be declared on July 27, officials said. Students who secure 33% in the test in each individual subject as well as in aggregate will be declared to have passed the entrance exam, the officials added.

59.title: Pune Police hold workshop on child sexual abuse; 900 schools participate
59.article_body: The Pune Police organised a sensitisation workshop on topics related to the sexual abuse of children. The online workshop, which was organised in association with other government and non-government bodies, discussed provisions of the POCSO Act and the concept of 'good touch-bad touch'. Notably, staff of around 900 various schools from Pune and surrounding areas participated in the workshop.

60.title: Pune woman robbed of ₹21 lakh by men posing as Aadhaar delivery agents
60.article_body: A woman was robbed of valuables worth ₹21.25 lakh at her residence by two men posing as Aadhaar card delivery agents in Pune on Saturday. The woman, who lives in the Somwar Peth area, was approached by the men at 11 am. She was reportedly home alone when the duo barged in and threatened her at knifepoint, police said.

61.title: Special tri-weekly train to run between Mangaluru, B'luru from Jul 26
61.article_body: An express train will be operated between Bengaluru and Mangaluru from July 26 onwards in view of disrupted road connectivity between the two cities. The train will depart from Bengaluru on Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday and from Mangaluru on Monday, Wednesday and Friday till August 31. It'll include two and three Tier AC, second class sleeper and general class seats.

62.title: CWG 2022 very important for us, we’re playing for a medal: Harmanpreet Kaur
62.article_body: India Women's captain Harmanpreet Kaur has said that Commonwealth Games 2022, where Women's cricket is making its debut, is very important for the team. Kaur added she has "grown up" watching multi-sporting events and she's already excited to walk with the rest of the contingent at the opening ceremony. India will face Australia in their opening game on July 29.

63.title: Govt believes scientific knowledge can be met by gazing at sky: Chidambaram
63.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticised the BJP-led Centre for raising the GST on scientific equipment needed by research institutions and universities "from 5% to 12-18%". "The government perhaps believes that all the scientific knowledge that we need can be gathered by gazing at the sky and re-imagining our past," Chidambaram said.

64.title: 2 Bengaluru policemen among 3 killed as car hits divider in Andhra
64.article_body: Three people, including two Bengaluru police personnel who were in Andhra Pradesh in connection with a drug case, were killed after their car hit a divider on Sunday, police said. The victims were identified as Sub-Inspector Avinash, Constable Anil Mulik and the car driver. Two more policemen, who were in the car, were injured in the accident.

65.title: Having Pak girl at centre was unique, I was excited: Farhan on Ms Marvel
65.article_body: Farhan Akhtar, who was seen in 'Ms Marvel', said in an interview that we've to be grateful for the push for diversity that's happening with storytelling in the West. "And that's what I...loved about Ms Marvel. To imagine Marvel would be making a series with...Pakistani Muslim girl at...centre is very unique...and I was excited to be...part of it," he added.

66.title: Chandni Chowk, Majnu ka Tila to be developed as food hubs: Kejriwal
66.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said Chandni Chowk and Majnu ka Tila will be developed as food hubs under the first phase of Delhi government's project to popularise Delhi as the food capital. The development would entail improvement of infrastructure and food safety norms. "Based on the learnings from these, we will develop other areas," Kejriwal added.

67.title: Ranbir-starrer Shamshera's shows cancelled in some cities over absence of audience: Reports
67.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, Sanjay Dutt and Vaani Kapoor-starrer Shamshera's shows were cancelled in several cities due to absence of audience, as per reports. The film earned ₹10.25 crore on the first day of its release on July 22. The film has been made at a budget of ₹150 crore, as per reports.

68.title: Traffic constable finds ₹45 lakh on road in Chhattisgarh, hands it over to police
68.article_body: A traffic policeman in Chhattisgarh's Raipur handed over a bag containing ₹45 lakh in cash at a police station after he found it on the road, an official said. Constable Nilamber Sinha found the cash comprising ₹2000 and ₹500 notes while on duty in the Mana police station limits area. A reward has been announced for him, said the official.

69.title: He came & conquered, again: Anupam Kher on Neeraj winning Worlds silver
69.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher congratulated athlete Neeraj Chopra for winning a silver medal in the men's javelin event at the World Athletics Championships 2022. Sharing Neeraj's throw on Twitter, Anupam wrote, "He came...We watched...He conquered...AGAIN!" Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories and congratulated Neeraj. She wrote, "The unstoppable Neeraj Chopra, pride of India."

70.title: Youth’s future in danger with new experiment in PM’s laboratory: Rahul on Agnipath
70.article_body: Commenting on the Agnipath scheme, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said youth's future is in danger. He tweeted, "60,000 soldiers retire every year, out of which only 3,000 are getting government jobs. What will be the future of thousands of Agniveers retiring after four-year contract? With this new experiment in PM’s laboratory, security of country and youth’s future are in danger."

71.title: My struggle was so much, I even thought of dying by suicide: Mithun Chakraborty
71.article_body: Talking about the most difficult phase of his career, actor Mithun Chakraborty said, "Everyone goes through struggles, but mine was so much. Sometimes I used to think I won't be able to achieve my goals." He added, "I even thought of dying by suicide. I couldn't even return to Kolkata due to some reasons."

72.title: Powerful laser that can be used to 'draw in the air' created by Chinese scientists
72.article_body: Scientists from China claim to have developed a device that can be used to "draw in the air without using paper and ink". The device uses ultra-short laser pulses to strip electrons off air molecules and turn them into light. In a demonstration, the scientists created characters using the laser which were visible from any angle and could be "touched".

73.title: Prostitution racket run by foreigners in South Delhi busted; 5 arrested, 10 women rescued
73.article_body: Delhi Police have busted a prostitution racket in South Delhi's Malviya Nagar area run by foreigners and arrested five people including a couple named Jumayeva Aziza and Meredob Ahmed from Turkmenistan and an Uzbek national. The accused used to lure foreign women to work in India and got them involved in prostitution, officials said. Delhi Police rescued 10 women.

74.title: Chiranjeevi Sarja's grandmother passes away, wife Meghana pens note
74.article_body: Actor Arjun Sarja's mother Lakshmi Devi, who was also the grandmother of late actor Chiranjeevi Sarja, has passed away. Chiranjeevi's wife Meghana penned a note remembering Lakshmi on Instagram, and wrote, "Ajji and I've had beautiful relationship." "We'd agreed to disagree on most things except for Chiru...when it came to him we'd think of nothing...but only the best," Meghana added.

75.title: I am broader than my contemporaries: Arjun on being body-shamed
75.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor, speaking about being body-shamed, has said he doesn't see enough "people respecting people" for accepting the way they look. "I'm physically not exactly up to what Indian standards of a man should be...because I'm broader than most other contemporaries...or...because I...put on a bit of weight in the process of it," he stated.

76.title: 9 of top 10 most valued firms add ₹2.98 lakh crore in m-cap in past week
76.article_body: Nine of the top 10 most valued firms added ₹2.98 lakh crore to their market valuation last week. While Reliance Industries' market capitalisation jumped by ₹68,564.65 crore to ₹16,93,245.73 crore, the valuation of Tata Consultancy Services surged by ₹64,929.87 crore to ₹11,60,285.19 crore. Infosys, Bajaj Finance, HDFC Bank and SBI were among the other gainers.

77.title: Credit Suisse planning more job cuts to reduce expenses: Report
77.article_body: Switzerland's second-biggest bank Credit Suisse is reportedly considering a fresh round of job cuts and other measures in order to cut expenses. The bank had warned in June that it would post a loss for the quarter, its third in a row. Last month, the bank announced job cuts in its Asia's investment team.

78.title: Judges shouldn't provoke critics, decide cases without fear: SC judge
78.article_body: Supreme Court Justice JB Pardiwala said a judicial officer should conduct himself in such a manner that he shouldn't "provoke" critics and decide cases without fear or favour. "As members of the judicial service, you perform the sacred duty of dispensing justice…it has to be religiously performed, consistent with the principles of ethics and in accordance with law," he added.

79.title: Delhi Police put up PM's posters at Delhi govt's event, CM Kejriwal to skip it: AAP
79.article_body: AAP alleged that Delhi Police forcibly put up banners carrying pictures of PM Narendra Modi at Delhi government's Van Mahotsav event. Environment Minister Gopal Rai said the Centre "hijacked" the event and turned it into a "political event" for PM Modi. Rai added that CM Arvind Kejriwal, who was scheduled to participate in the event on Sunday, will skip it.

80.title: Stealing to weed: Bengaluru Police shares video to warn 2-wheeler thieves
80.article_body: The Bengaluru Police shared a video of 76 two-wheelers recovered from across two police stations placed in shape of marijuana leaf to warn two-wheeler thieves of harsh action. Taking to Twitter, DCP CK Baba shared the video and wrote, "Stealing to weed, Wheeling on the stolen bikes, And then selling them at a price...Now cooling his heels in lock up."

81.title: I'd like to share my greetings to Neeraj's family in Panipat: Haryana CM Khattar
81.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has congratulated Neeraj Chopra for winning the silver medal in the men's javelin throw at the World Athletics Championships. "Neeraj has made Haryana proud, I'd like to share my greetings to his family in Panipat and congratulate them on their son's success," said CM Khattar. Neeraj won with a best throw of 88.13 metres.

82.title: Toppr.com Founder Zishaan Hayath buys property in Mumbai for ₹41 crore: Report
82.article_body: Toppr.com Founder Zishaan Hayath has reportedly bought a 4,000 sq ft sea-facing apartment in Bandra, Mumbai, for ₹41 crore. Toppr.com was acquired by BYJU's last year. As per a report, the apartment is located on the 13th floor of the Rustomjee La Fontaine on Turner Road. While the building has 15 floors, only eight of them are habitable.

83.title: Police bust sex racket in Thane; 3 women rescued, 1 arrested
83.article_body: A prostitution racket was busted by the police near a restaurant in the Wagle Estate area in Thane. Three women, aged 18 to 22 years, were rescued and another woman was arrested for allegedly running the racket, police said. The accused used to charge ₹20,000 per customer and pay ₹3,000 out of it to the three victims, police added.

84.title: People's mandate does not prevail in today's democratic system: Alva
84.article_body: The Opposition candidate for the Vice-Presidential polls, Margaret Alva has said that the "tragedy of today's democratic system is that the mandate of people does not prevail". "Muscle and money power and threats change the composition of the elected framework," Alva said. "How can a democracy function with the government slogan seemingly being 'my way or no way'," she asked.

85.title: Maha will have to face mid-term polls, govt will soon collapse: Aaditya Thackeray
85.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday said that the Maharashtra government will soon collapse. "Mark my words...this government will soon collapse and Maharashtra will have to face mid-term polls," Aaditya added. "While working in the government, Uddhav Ji's only mistake was that he couldn't indulge in politicking. He did not snoop on his MLAs and MPs," he stated.

86.title: It'll be like riding a horse & using a flip phone: Musk on gas cars without autonomy
86.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Self-driving electric cars will be all that matters," in the future. "Gas car without autonomy will be like riding a horse and using a flip phone. That still happens, but it is niche," the world's richest person further said. Notably, Tesla is currently working on full self-driving (FSD) software for its electric cars.

87.title: It's like how all expect Alia Bhatt films to be: Ranbir on 'Darlings'
87.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor has revealed that he has seen his wife and actress Alia Bhatt's upcoming film 'Darlings'. "It is an amazing film. Like how everyone expects Alia Bhatt films to be, it is at that level," he further stated. The film is Alia's first as a producer and she will be seen alongside actress Shefali Shah and actor Vijay Varma.

88.title: 'Bhabi Ji...' actors Saumya, Rohitashv pen tribute to Deepesh Bhan
88.article_body: Actor Rohitashv Gour remembered 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai!' co-star Deepesh Bhan, who passed away on Saturday. "Life is so unpredictable...yesterday, I uploaded an Instagram reel with Deepesh...today he is not here with us," Rohitashv wrote on Instagram. Saumya Tandon, who was a part of the show, wrote on Instagram, "Can't believe you're gone...You were a heart of gold."

89.title: MVA collapse happened due to Uddhav, Fadnavis shouldn't take all credit: Raj
89.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that neither Amit Shah nor Devendra Fadnavis are responsible for the MVA government's collapse. "I told Fadnavis to not take much credit as all credit...goes to Uddhav Thackeray," he said in an interview. He added that though some people accuse Sanjay Raut and his statements for the collapse, even he is not responsible for it.

90.title: I don't think selectors are thinking about Dhawan for T20Is: Saba Karim
90.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Saba Karim, on being asked about Shikhar Dhawan's place in Team India's T20I squad, said he doesn't think the selectors are thinking about the 36-year-old for the shortest format. "The T20 format is different; the demands in T20 cricket are different. [And] there are a number of talented players we are seeing at the moment," explained Karim.

91.title: Everyone in Bengal knew about it: Adhir Ranjan on TMC minister's arrest
91.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has commented on TMC leader and West Bengal minister, Partha Chatterjee being arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. "Everyone in Bengal knew about this (scam). After the court's intervention, investigation agencies started acting upon it. We want culprits to be punished," Chowdhury said.

92.title: My most successful film: Adivi as 'Major' completes 50 days in theatres
92.article_body: Actor Adivi Sesh took to Twitter to share a post marking 50 days since the release of 'Major'. "50 days since #MajorTheFilm released. My most Successful Film. My most MEANINGFUL Film. #MajorSandeepUnnikrishnan sir has blessed us," he wrote. The film is based on the life of NSG commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

93.title: Send Rahul back to fight from Amethi in 2024 & he’ll lose again: Smriti Irani
93.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday reacted to the allegations of her daughter Zoish running an “illegal” bar in Goa. “To the Gandhi family, which directed that this press conference be held against my child, I tell you to send Rahul Gandhi back to fight the Lok Sabha election in 2024 from Amethi and he’ll lose again,” Irani said.

94.title: Tesla planning same-hour service for cars using Formula 1 techniques
94.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted that the company is aiming at providing same-hour services for its vehicles. Musk tweeted, "Excited to work with Tesla Service to enable same-hour service as often as possible! Applying Formula 1 pit crew techniques to Teslas." Earlier in 2015, Tesla had hired F1 veteran Kenny Handkammer as Global Director of Service Innovation.

95.title: Telangana Governor Dr Soundararajan saves IPS officer's life on flight to Hyderabad
95.article_body: Telangana Governor Dr Tamilisai Soundararajan discharged her duties as a doctor and saved the life of Kripanand Tripathi Ujela, a 1994-batch IPS officer of Andhra Pradesh cadre, onboard an Indigo flight from Delhi to Hyderabad on Saturday. Ujela is now undergoing treatment in a hospital in Hyderabad after being diagnosed with dengue fever.

96.title: Marvel announces two new Avengers films, to release in 2025
96.article_body: Marvel Studios announced a slew of superhero movies including two new Avengers films at the San Diego Comic-Con on Saturday. 'Avengers: The Kang Dynasty' will release in theatres on May 2, 2025, while 'Avengers: Secret Wars' will hit the screens on November 7, 2025. Other Marvel films announced on Saturday included 'Thunderbolts' and 'Fantastic Four', both due in 2024.

97.title: People feel food, clothes must come at lower prices: RSS leader
97.article_body: RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale has commented on the rising inflation in India. "The link between inflation and food prices needs to be pondered over...People feel food and clothes must come at lower prices. It...should be affordable," Hosabale said. "The farmer must benefit from doubling the farmer scheme. He does not always get a guaranteed income," he added.

98.title: Free to leave alliance: Samajwadi Party to Shivpal and OP Rajbhar
98.article_body: Samajwadi Party told MLA Shivpal Yadav and SBSP chief Om Prakash Rajbhar that they are "free to leave" the alliance. The development comes after both Shivpal and Rajbhar supported rival NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. In its letter, SP claimed that Rajbhar is working for BJP and asked Shivpal to leave if he feels he will get more respect elsewhere.

99.title: My heartiest congratulations to Suriya for winning Nat'l Award: Rajinikanth
99.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth took to Twitter to congratulate actor Suriya for winning the Best Actor award at the 68th National Film Awards. Suriya won the award for his role in 'Soorarai Pottru'. "My heartiest congratulations and appreciation to Suriya, who won the National Film Award, the film director and all the award-winning film artists," Rajinikanth tweeted.

100.title: Will support whatever Elon decides: Binance CEO on Musk's Twitter deal
100.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao spoke about Tesla CEO Elon Musk's decision regarding the $44 billion Twitter acquisition deal. After a Twitter user asked him to "buy Twitter", Zhao replied, "It might be slightly overpriced. But will support whatever Elon decides. There is a time to lead, and a time to follow."

101.title: 3 people arrested in Mumbai for defrauding real estate agent of ₹3.12 crore
101.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested three people for allegedly defrauding a real estate agent of ₹3.12 crore. The three accused, Kisanbhai Salaat, Haribhai Salaat and Manish Shah, are natives of Vadodara and cheated the victim, Hemant Mulchand Vaviya (40), by handing him fake gold coins in exchange for money, police said. Notably, the incident took place on April 18.

102.title: Delhi reports first case of monkeypox, patient has no history of foreign travel
102.article_body: Delhi has reported its first case of monkeypox infection, confirmed the Health Ministry on Sunday. The patient is a 31-year-old man with no history of foreign travel, who was admitted to the Maulana Azad Medical College Hospital with fever and skin lesions, reported ANI. Notably, it is India's fourth case of monkeypox infection after three cases were reported in Kerala.

103.title: Most things in industry aren't equal, have experienced it personally: Tara
103.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria has said that she has been brought up in a household of "very strong women" and never understood the concept of inequality. "Yes, it's true in our industry most things aren't equal...I have experienced it personally, so I can only speak for myself," she added. Tara, however, stated that things are slowly changing now.

104.title: Samantha, Akshay to team up for Johar's mythological drama: Reports
104.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Samantha Ruth Prabhu are reportedly teaming up for a mythological epic drama. According to reports, the upcoming project will be produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions. Akshay and Samantha recently appeared together on Johar's chat show 'Koffee With Karan'. Samantha will reportedly make her Bollywood debut in an Ayushmann Khurrana-starrer film.

105.title: Rajnath Singh, Anurag Thakur, JP Nadda congratulate Neeraj for historic silver
105.article_body: Reacting to Neeraj Chopra winning India's first-ever silver medal at the World Athletics Championships, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh tweeted, "India is elated by the stupendous performance by Subedar Neeraj Chopra." Sports Minister Anurag Thakur shared a video of his medal-winning throw and wrote, "Olympic champion Neeraj wins historic silver...[he] has now won a medal at every global event."

106.title: Fardeen to make OTT debut with Bhansali's Heeramandi: Reports
106.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan is set to make his digital debut with Sanjay Leela Bhansali's upcoming web series 'Heeramandi', according to reports. The actor has reportedly filmed a few portions already. Fardeen Khan, who was last seen in the 2010 film 'Dulha Mil Gaya', will make his comeback in Sanjay Gupta's next production 'Visfot', which will also feature Riteish Deshmukh.

107.title: Stock markets record best week since Feb 2021; Sensex & Nifty gain over 4%
107.article_body: Stock markets closed at their highest level in seven weeks on Friday to record their best week since February 2021. While BSE Sensex gained 390 points and finished at 56,072, Nifty rose 0.7% to settle at 16,719.45 on Friday. Both the indexes hit their highest since June 3 and gained over 4% this week.

108.title: Working with Marvel was no different than B'wood films: Farhan Akhtar
108.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar opened up about his experience of working in the Marvel series 'Ms Marvel'. "My experience of working with Marvel was no different than working in any film from India and Marvel would back me up for saying this," he stated. Farhan added, "Filmmaking is about finding order in chaos...Enjoyment is...palpable when you have a brilliant crew."

109.title: Taiwanese actor, his son hospitalised after Tesla crashes, pic of car in flames surfaces
109.article_body: Taiwanese actor Jimmy Lin Chih-ying and his son have been hospitalised after the Tesla car being driven by the celebrity crashed into a pole and burst into flames. Pictures of Lin's car after the accident went viral on social media, showing the entire front ruined and badly damaged. Lin has suffered injuries to his head and shoulder, as per reports.

110.title: Welcome to the group, it was a long wait: Anju Bobby George to Neeraj
110.article_body: Neeraj Chopra won a historic silver at the World Athletics Championships in Oregon to become the second Indian after Anju Bobby George to win a medal at the event. Anju Bobby George won a bronze medal in long jump at Paris in 2003. She tweeted, "Congratulations Neeraj Chopra for that magic moment...And welcome to the group...It was a long wait."

111.title: Indian society deeply patriarchal, affecting women’s career progress: SC judge
111.article_body: Indian society is deeply patriarchal, culturally and economically, and is severely affecting the career progress of working women, Supreme Court Justice S Ravindra Bhat said. "Many women...feel the need to step off the career track entirely not because of explicit discrimination or lack of ambition, competence or ability but because of numerous smaller factors and daily hassles," he added.

112.title: 3-storey house collapses in Delhi's Mustafabad; 1 dead, 3 injured
112.article_body: At least one person died and three were injured after a three-storey house collapsed in Northeast Delhi's Mustafabad area on Sunday. According to reports, the incident took place at around 5 am at Babu Nagar Chane Wali Gali. A total of three fire tenders were rushed to the site as soon as Delhi Fire Department was informed of the incident.

113.title: 5-foot python found in backseat of auto-rickshaw in Thane
113.article_body: A five-foot-long Indian Rock Python slithered into the backseat of a roadside parked auto-rickshaw on Saturday in Thane's Titwala area. The passenger who was about to enter the auto saw the snake lying in the backseat. Later, the auto driver frantically dialled a snake charmer from a wildlife NGO who caught the python and transferred it into a transportation carrier.

114.title: RRTS work restricted in Ghaziabad, Meerut till July 27 due to Kanwar Yatra
114.article_body: The Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) project has been halted on Delhi-Meerut road, between Ghaziabad and Meerut till the culmination of the ongoing Kanwar Yatra. The Ghaziabad and Meerut traffic police have imposed major diversions which will be in place till the morning of July 27, officials said. The 82-kilometre-long project is being developed at a cost of ₹30,274 crore.

115.title: Usually, we talk about the top-3 not getting runs: Parthiv Patel on 1st WI ODI
115.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel praised India's batting after their win in the first ODI against West Indies. "Shikhar Dhawan played a captain's knock. He was very well supported by Shubman Gill...Shreyas also came back in form...India's top-three got fifties. Usually, we talk about India's top-three not getting runs," stated Parthiv. India posted 308/7 and won by three runs.

116.title: A special moment for Indian sports: PM Modi on Neeraj Chopra's historic silver
116.article_body: PM Narendra Modi congratulated Neeraj Chopra for winning India's first-ever silver medal at the World Athletics Championships. He tweeted, "A great accomplishment by one of our most distinguished athletes! This is a special moment for Indian sports." Chopra became only the second Indian athlete after Anju Bobby George to win a medal in the World Championships.

117.title: Conditions weren't great, there was a lot of wind: Neeraj after winning Worlds silver
117.article_body: After becoming the first-ever Indian to win a silver medal at World Athletics Championships, Neeraj Chopra said, "It was quite challenging...but there was...belief inside that I'll keep going until the end." He added, "The conditions weren't that great and there was a lot of wind."  Neeraj stated, "I'm quite happy with the performance. I was able to learn a lot."

118.title: TMC stands for 'The Mountain of Corruption': Anurag Thakur
118.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that TMC stands for "The Mountain of Corruption". His remark came after West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee’s arrest by the ED. "Mamata Banerjee is breaking all the records of corruption…Corruption is running rampant in her party and her government. Her ministers have a free hand to indulge in corruption," Thakur added.

119.title: Shouldn't give importance to trolls in life: Arjun on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
119.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has reacted to Ranveer Singh being trolled for his nude photoshoot. "Trolls ko importance deni hi nahi chahiye zindagi mein (We should not give importance to trolls in our lives)," Arjun stated. "Whatever you feel right, you should do it...full credit to the boy if he is...happy doing what he is doing...we should respect that," he added.

120.title: India reports 20,279 new COVID-19 cases, active cases reach 1,52,200
120.article_body: India has reported 20,279 COVID-19 cases, 18,143 recoveries and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 21,411 cases and 67 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,52,200, while the death toll reached 5,26,033.

121.title: I've stopped buying cars often, driving 8-yr-old car these days: Ranbir
121.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor in an interview said, "As I've grown older, I'm less excited by material things." "I've stopped buying cars often. The car I'm driving these days is eight years old...And I'm not into jewellery or watches," he added. Ranbir, however, said that he'll continue to collect sneakers and will try to make his child a "sneaker freaker, too".

122.title: I'm numb, worried for his wife & kid: Nehha on co-star Deepesh's death
122.article_body: Actress Nehha Pendse, mourning the demise of 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' co-actor Deepesh Bhan, said, "I'm very numb right now and don't know how to react to this." She added that Deepesh lost his mother in November. "Now I'm more worried for his wife and kid. The baby is too young and he got married very late," said Nehha.

123.title: Eldhose Paul, 1st Indian to reach triple jump final at World C'ships, finishes 9th
123.article_body: Eldhose Paul, who created history by becoming the first-ever Indian to reach triple jump final in the history of World Athletics Championships, finished ninth in the event. Paul produced his best jump of 16.79m in the three attempts he had in the final. Tokyo Olympic champion Pedro Pichardo of Portugal won the gold medal with a best jump of 17.95m.

124.title: Ganja supplying racket busted in Hyderabad, 4 held
124.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested four persons, including an interstate Ganja supplier, who were found transporting and selling contraband Ganja illegally in Telangana and other states. The police also seized 102 kg of Ganja worth around ₹20 lakh, one Swift Dzire car and three cell phones. The accused and the seized material were handed over to SHO of Hussainialam police station.

125.title: Video shows Neeraj's throw that gave India its 1st silver in World Athletics Championships
125.article_body: Neeraj Chopra was out of the medal race till his third attempt in the men's javelin final at the World Athletics Championships, however, he managed to pull off an 88.13m throw in the fourth round that won India its first silver. Grenada's Anderson Peters won gold with a best throw of 90.54m, while Czech Republic's Jakub Vadlejch won bronze.

126.title: How has Neeraj Chopra performed this year and what is his best throw?
126.article_body: Javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has finished first or second in all the competitions he has participated in this year. He bagged silver at Paavo Nurmi Games (89.30 metres), gold at Kuortane Games (86.69 metres). He finished second at Stockholm Diamond League with a career-best throw of 89.94 metres. He bagged India's first silver medal at World Athletics Championships (88.13 metres).

127.title: Watching 66 films in short time was challenging: Nat'l Awards jury chairman
127.article_body: Filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah has said that being named the chairman of the National Awards jury was an honour for him. "Watching 66 films in a short span of time was challenging and the entire jury was completely committed to the task," he stated. Vipul added, "They (jury) have done a great job, so my congratulations to all of them."

128.title: Journalist shares pic of IndiGo MD having biscuit & tea onboard, Twitter users react
128.article_body: A journalist on Friday shared a photo of IndiGo’s Promoter and MD Rahul Bhatia eating a Parle-G biscuit dipped in tea onboard. He wrote, "[This] shows you don't have to be Richard Branson or Vijay Mallya to build a successful airline with 57% market share." Meanwhile, a Twitter user wrote, "Grounded and down to earth", and another commented, "That's simplicity!"

129.title: Believe it or not! Indira Gandhi is acting like Kangana Ranaut: RGV
129.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma shared an interview of Indira Gandhi from 1984 on Twitter and wrote, "Believe it or not! Indira Gandhi is acting like Kangana Ranaut." This comes as Kangana is set to portray Indira Gandhi in 'Emergency'. Posting the screenshot of his tweet on Instagram Stories, Kangana wrote, "Thank you...it's reassuring as I cast myself in this role."

130.title: No judiciary in world is as independent as India’s: Rijiju
130.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday said no judiciary in the world is as independent as India’s. His statement came after CJI NV Ramana's remark on media running "kangaroo courts". "Indian judges and judiciary are completely protected. I can say clearly that no judge or judiciary is as independent anywhere in the world as it is in India," Rijiju added.

131.title: Fake news & hearsay: BYJU'S Co-founder on reports of ₹86.21 crore dues to BCCI
131.article_body: BYJU'S Co-founder Divya Gokulnath has responded to reports claiming that the edtech startup owes ₹86.21 crore as dues to the BCCI. Calling it a "fake news story", Gokulnath said, "We expect at least...real journalists to...not get swayed by hearsay and concocted stories by vested parties." Earlier, BYJU'S denied the reports and said, "There are no dues pending from our side."

132.title: 15-yr-old Nagpur boy wins coding contest, gets US job; loses offer after age revealed
132.article_body: A 15-year-old boy in Nagpur bagged a job from a US company after he won a website development contest that he had come across on Instagram. While the company offered him a ₹33 lakh per annum salary, they withdrew the offer after finding out Vedant Deokate's age. Vedant reportedly wrote over 2,000 lines of codes in about two days.

133.title: Eknath Shinde was made CM with heavy heart: Maharashtra BJP chief
133.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Saturday said it was decided with a "heavy heart" that Eknath Shinde would become the new CM of the state. "The central leadership and Devendra Ji (Devendra Fadnavis) decided to back Eknath Shinde as CM with a heavy heart," Patil added. "We were unhappy but decided to accept the decision," he stated.

134.title: I've always tried to follow Stokes, he's a huge loss for ODI team: Curran
134.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who returned last month from an injury he suffered in IPL 2021, has said Ben Stokes' retirement from ODIs is a "huge loss" for the white-ball squad. "I've always tried to follow the way he trains and the way he plays," he stated. Curran's comments came after his match-winning performance in the second South Africa ODI.

135.title: SP's Azam Khan urges UP govt to provide him 'Z' category security
135.article_body: SP leader Azam Khan, who was recently released from Sitapur jail, urged the UP government to reinstate his 'Z' category security, contending that he and his family faced "many threats". "Right now I have 'Y' category security which is of no relevance," he said. In 2017, Yogi Adityanath's government had downgraded the security cover of over 100 politicians including Khan.

136.title: Twitter spent $33 million on Elon Musk's takeover deal in three months
136.article_body: Twitter spent $33 million on its pending acquisition by the world's richest person Elon Musk during the second quarter of 2022, the company revealed in its earnings release. Twitter also partially blamed Musk for the "uncertainty" surrounding the deal for a decline in its quarterly revenue. Earlier this month, Twitter sued Musk after he proposed terminating the $44 billion deal.

137.title: 1 killed, 6 injured after shooting in Washington
137.article_body: A shooting in Renton, Washington has left a 32-year-old man dead and six others injured and hospitalised with gunshot wounds, police said. An initial investigation indicated a dispute outside of a large gathering that led to the gunfire possibly by more than one suspect, police said. Police added that "this is not an active shooter situation".

138.title: Number of startups in India grew from 471 in 2016 to 72,993 in 2022: Govt
138.article_body: The total number of recognised startups in India rose from 471 in 2016 to 72,993 as of June 30 2022, said Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Som Parkash. In a written reply to the Rajya Sabha, Parkash said recognising this, the Centre had launched the Startup India initiative in 2016 to build an ecosystem for India's startups.

139.title: Hussain Sagar lake overflows due to incessant rain in Hyderabad
139.article_body: Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake started overflowing on Saturday due to incessant rainfall in Telangana with the water level rising over the Full Tank Level (FTL) of 513.41 metres. The water level in the lake after incessant rains was measured at 513.43 metres. Due to the overflow, other tanks inside the boundaries of Hyderabad are reportedly very close to breaking.

140.title: Neeraj Chopra wins India's first silver medal in World Athletics Championships history
140.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has become the first-ever Indian to win a silver medal at World Athletics Championships. The 24-year-old finished second in men's javelin throw final at World Athletics Championships 2022 with a best throw of 88.13 metres. Neeraj is the second Indian after ex-long jumper Anju Bobby George to bag a World Athletics Championships medal.

141.title: Jammu & Kashmir records 557 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths
141.article_body: Jammu & Kashmir on Saturday reported 557 fresh cases of COVID-19 and two deaths from the infection, officials informed. According to officials, 282 of the 557 cases were reported from Jammu division and the 275 remaining from Kashmir valley. The Union Territory now has 2,801 active cases, officials added. The cases took J&K's total COVID-19 tally to 4,59,544, officials said.

142.title: Brother held after Delhi man found dead in fridge, ₹4 lakh seized
142.article_body: After the body of a 50-year-old man was found stuffed in a refrigerator in Delhi's Seelampur, his brother and another person were arrested in connection with the murder, police said. The accused, Aabid Hussain and Jahid, said they had come to the deceased's house with an intention of theft, police added. Police said they've seized ₹4 lakh cash and jewellery.

143.title: Iraq urges UNSC for urgent meeting over alleged Turkish airstrike
143.article_body: Iraq on Saturday submitted a request to the UNSC for an urgent meeting over the alleged Turkish airstrikes that hit a resort in Duhok earlier this week, the country's Foreign Ministry informed. Baghdad has blamed Ankara for the strike that killed nine civilians and wounded several others on Wednesday. Duhok province is part of the Iraqi semi-autonomous region of Kurdistan.

144.title: Ukraine strikes bridge on Russian supply route in Kherson
144.article_body: Ukrainian missile strikes hit a bridge on a Russian supply route in the Russia-occupied Kherson region on Saturday, a Ukrainian official said. "This is not yet the liberation of Kherson, but a serious preparatory step in that direction," the official wrote on Facebook. A Russia-installed official said that though the bridge was hit, it was still usable, TASS reported.

145.title: 13 killed, 30 injured as rival militias clash in Libya
145.article_body: Violence between rival militias in Libya's capital Tripoli has killed at least 13 people, including a 12-year-old child and wounded 30 others. The two competing militias are involved in a months-long political battle, leading to several clashes. Libya's transition to an elected government fell through last year after an interim government failed to hold polls.

146.title: 27-yr-old arrested for stealing pistol from Army man's home in MP
146.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested in Jabalpur on Saturday for allegedly stealing a pistol, bullets and ornaments from the house of an Army officer who was out of town. The accused, Rahul Valmik, hid an iron rod in a broom and entered Lieutenant Colonel Arun Malik's residence posing as a sweeper. Valmik broke the lock using the rod, officials said.

147.title: 50 million facing acute food insecurity: East African Bloc
147.article_body: Over 50 million people in East Africa are expected to experience acute food insecurity this year, the Intergovernmental Authority on Development has said. The eight-country bloc said around 300,000 people in Somalia and South Sudan would experience total famine conditions. United Nations agencies and other groups have recently cautioned over the region's food shortage.

148.title: Couldn't have been better: Nayanthara on Janhvi's remake 'Good Luck Jerry'
148.article_body: Actress Nayanthara recently said that there could not have been a better Jerry than Janhvi in the film 'Good Luck Jerry' which is the remake of her 2018 Tamil film 'Kolamaavu Kokila'. Nayanthara further said, "Kokila is so close to my heart and watching the GoodLuck Jerry trailer brings me so much joy, what an entertaining ride...audience is in for."

149.title: Chennai businessman's wife raped by him & his friend, both arrested
149.article_body: A businessman based in Chennai and his friend were arrested in Thrissur, Kerala, for allegedly beating and raping the former's wife on multiple occasions in the past two years, officials said on Saturday. The police were alerted after the 35-year-old victim went to a private hospital. The accused were also booked for trying to spread the assault through social media.

150.title: Pak's death toll from monsoon rains & flooding rises to 304
150.article_body: The death toll from over five weeks of monsoon rains and flash flooding across Pakistan rose to 304, according to authorities. At least 284 people have been injured in the rains and flash flooding since mid-June. Balochistan province is the worst-hit in the country with 99 people dead in rain-related incidents and subsequent flooding.

151.title: My inspiration is 39-year-old Anderson: Mathews ahead of his 100th Test
151.article_body: Ahead of his 100th Test, Sri Lanka all-rounder Angelo Mathews called 39-year-old England pacer James Anderson as his inspiration. "Being a fast bowler, he still wants to play a couple of more years," he added. The 35-year-old further said that he's still willing to give his best in all three formats. He'll play his 100th Test on Sunday against Pakistan.

152.title: Amit Shah inaugurates sanskrutik bhavan, mid-day meal kitchen in Guj
152.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday launched a series of projects in Gujarat. He inaugurated a CCTV-based command and control room for police in Gandhinagar. Later, he inaugurated the Sardar Patel Sanskrutik Bhavan and Akshaya Patra mid-day meal kitchen in Gandhinagar's Mansa. He said the kitchen will help provide nutritious food to children at government schools in Mansa.

153.title: What are the WHO's recommendations to nations on monkeypox?
153.article_body: After declaring monkeypox a global health emergency, WHO declared recommendations for four groups of nations- those without any cases, with recently imported cases, with animal-to-human spread and those with manufacturing capacity for vaccines. For those with recently imported cases, WHO recommended applying coordinated response, engaging and protecting communities, intensifying surveillance etc.

154.title: 16-yr-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa meets Rajinikanth, shares pics
154.article_body: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa met actor Rajinikanth on Saturday and took to Twitter to share pictures. The 16-year-old met Rajinikanth ahead of the 44th Chess Olympiad, scheduled to start in Chennai on July 28. "A day to remember!!! Met @rajinikanth uncle today with my family! Inspired by his humbleness despite reaching great heights!" he wrote.

155.title: You might see Hardik Pandya quit ODIs after 2023 World Cup in India: Shastri
155.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that Hardik Pandya might quit ODIs after 2023 World Cup in India. "Hardik wants to play T20 cricket and he is very clear in his mind that 'I do not want to play anything else'," Shastri added. He further stated that players choosing formats will become a common thing.

156.title: Nawazuddin shoots for 'Afwaah' in Raj where he shot 'Bypass' with Irrfan
156.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui recentlly shot for the upcoming film 'Afwaah' in Rajasthan where he had also shot for the film 'Bypass' with late actor Irrfan Khan. The film 'Bypass' was screened at the Edinburgh International Film Festival and Aubagne Film Festival. 'Afwaah', which also features Bhumi Pednekar, is a drama film directed by Sudhir Mishra.

157.title: Who are the oldest Indian captains to slam a fifty in men's ODI cricket?
157.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan (36 years and 229 days) became the oldest Indian captain to slam an ODI fifty, during the first ODI against West Indies. The previous oldest Indian captain to score ODI fifty was Mohammed Azharuddin (36 years and 120 days). Azharuddin is followed by Sunil Gavaskar (35 years and 225 days) and MS Dhoni (35 years and 108 days).

158.title: Taliban kill youth & display his body publicly in Afghan market
158.article_body: A young man was shot dead by the Taliban in Afghanistan, local news agencies said, adding that his corpse was publicly displayed at the Andarab district market. The incident took place on Wednesday, following which residents marched with the body and sought an explanation from the Taliban on Thursday. They also fired shots in the air to disperse the gathering.

159.title: Sack Smriti Irani: Congress' Pawan Khera amid 'illegal' bar row
159.article_body: At a press meet on Saturday, Congress leader Pawan Khera said, "We demand from the Prime Minister that Smriti Irani should be immediately sacked as a [Union Minister]...You owe it to this country." This comes amid allegations of Irani's daughter Zoish running an "illegal" bar in Goa. "Was the illegal act carried out without [Smriti's] knowledge or influence?" Khera asked.

160.title: Cuba announces referendum on legalising same-sex marriage
160.article_body: Cuba's Parliament on Friday announced that a referendum will be held on September 25 on a new family law that would legalise same-sex marriages and surrogate parenthood. "We are convinced that in due time, the majority of the Cuban people will endorse this revolutionary, inclusive and democratic code," the Parliament's secretary said.

161.title: Ready to do anything for the team to help it win Asia Cup and World Cup: Virat Kohli
161.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli, who has been rested for the white-ball series against West Indies, said his main aim is to help India win Asia Cup and World Cup. "For that I am ready to do anything for the team," he added. The Asia Cup will begin in August, while the T20 World Cup 2022 will begin in October.

162.title: Centre amends Flag Code of India, Tricolour can now be flown day and night
162.article_body: The Centre has amended the Flag Code of India, allowing the Tricolour to now be flown by the public both day and night. Earlier, the Tricolour was allowed to be flown from sunrise to sunset, irrespective of weather conditions. The government had earlier also amended the provision for material used for producing Tricolour by permitting polyester and machine-made Tricolour.

163.title: 2017 Women's WC final helped turn a page in Indian women's cricket: Mithali
163.article_body: Remembering 2017 Women's World Cup final on its fifth anniversary, Mithali Raj, who led India to the final against England, tweeted, "This day at Lord's in 2017 didn't favour us but I believe it helped turn a page in Indian women's cricket." She added, "It changed the perspective towards women's cricket in India." England defeated India by nine runs.

164.title: When he bats, it seems he's million-dollar: Aakash on Gill's 64 vs WI
164.article_body: Praising Shubman Gill following his 53-ball 64 in India's three-run win against West Indies in first ODI, Aakash Chopra said the India opener batted "extremely well". He added, "The way he started with the drive, after that the punch...he's brilliant. When he bats, it seems he is million-dollar." Gill hit six fours and two sixes during his maiden ODI half-century.

165.title: North Korea warns US, South Korea against military exercises
165.article_body: North Korea has warned the United States and South Korea against conducting joint military drills, saying these exercises were pushing the Korean Peninsula to war. Choe Jin, a senior official in Pyongyang, accused the two countries of planning to deploy US nuclear assets in their future drills. The comments come as Washington and Seoul prepare for upcoming military drills.

166.title: 500 condoms, 400 liquor bottles found in brothel allegedly run by BJP leader in Meghalaya
166.article_body: Six children were rescued and 73 people arrested from a "brothel" allegedly run by BJP's Meghalaya Vice-President Bernard N Marak in Tura on Saturday, said police. Rimpu Bagan, a farmhouse owned by Marak, was raided on the basis of a tip-off. In the raid, 27 vehicles, eight two-wheelers, about 400 bottles of liquor and over 500 unused condoms were seized.

167.title: I was scared of hosting 'Khatron...' due to superstars: Rohit Shetty
167.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has said that he was initially scared of hosting reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' because of the participation of "actors and superstars". He further said that he knew it was the right choice to host it when he heard the TRPs. "My manager came running saying...it's the highest-rated show. I could not believe it," the filmmaker added.

168.title: Preparing to export grain from ports despite Russian attack: Ukraine
168.article_body: Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said Ukraine continues to prepare to restart grain exports from its Black Sea ports despite a Russian missile strike that hit Odesa port on Saturday. Notably, Russia attacked Odesa less than 24 hours after signing a UN-backed agreement with Ukraine aimed at restarting the grain exports. Russia had blocked the Ukrainian ports amid the war.

169.title: Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee hospitalised hours after arrest
169.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a teacher recruitment scam, was admitted to the Intensive Coronary Care Unit (ICCU) of SSKM Hospital after he complained of uneasiness, an official of ED said. According to a hospital official, several tests, including electrocardiogram, were conducted. "He is stable at the moment," the official added.

170.title: Tamil Nadu govt sends more relief material to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
170.article_body:
The Tamil Nadu government on Saturday dispatched another round of essential items to Sri Lanka 
amid an economic crisis in the country. DMK MP Kanimozhi tweeted and said she flagged off the consignment from the VOC Port in Thoothukudi in the presence of state ministers. The relief material included rice, medicines and other essential commodities, valued around ₹74 crore.

171.title: I had promised my father I won't ever lose my dignity: Rupali Ganguly on casting couch
171.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Rupali Ganguly spoke to ETimes and shared that casting couch existed in 90s and hence she stepped out of the film industry. "I had a film background but I had promised my father...I won't ever lose my dignity," she said. "I couldn't handle how the industry worked then, especially...casting couch...I decided I can't deal with it," Rupali added.

172.title: Be in no doubt, I'm the underdog: Rishi Sunak on race to be next UK PM
172.article_body: Speaking about the race to become the next UK PM, ex-British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak said, "Be in no doubt, I am the underdog." "The forces that be want this to be a coronation for the other candidate, but I think members want a choice," he added. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss is the second candidate in the race.

173.title: 10 dead, 7 injured as mountain collapses at coal mine in China
173.article_body: Ten people were killed and seven were injured on Saturday after a section of a mountain collapsed at a coal mine in China's Gansu province, Chinese state media outlet CCTV reported.
