The report said that the landslide occurred while employees were moving around the mining site. An investigation is now reportedly underway to determine the cause of the accident.

174.title: Sri Lankan Cabinet expected to be expanded: Lankan minister
174.article_body: Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe is expected to expand his Cabinet to include all Opposition parties in it, Tourism Minister Harin Fernando said. Wickremesinghe on Friday formed an 18-member Cabinet after the previous government was dissolved following months-long public protests. The newly named Cabinet has 16 members from the same party, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.

175.title: 28 kg whale vomit worth ₹28 crore found by fishermen in Kerala
175.article_body: A group of fishermen from Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram found 28.4 kg of ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in the sea and handed it over to the Kerala Coastal Police. The ambergris was later collected by Kerala Forest Department. Ambergris, which is produced in the digestive system of sperm whales, is used to manufacture perfumes.

176.title: Alia gave 'Gangubai...', she can demand what she wants: Arjun on pay parity
176.article_body: Speaking about the lack of pay parity in the film industry, actor Arjun Kapoor said that actress Alia Bhatt has delivered 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' following which she can demand what she wants. "You earn your right...It's not even about parity...You should be paid your worth. You have to prove your worth and then you should be paid," the actor added.

177.title: Pak PM's son Hamza Sharif takes oath as Punjab CM after re-election
177.article_body: Hamza Sharif, the son of Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif, on Saturday took oath as the CM of Punjab province after being re-elected to the post following a run-off election. Sharif won by three votes after Deputy Speaker Dost Muhammad Mazari rejected 10 votes of his rival candidate Chaudhry Pervaiz Elahi's party. Elahi has approached the Supreme Court over Mazari's decision.

178.title: Complaint lodged against singer Sravana Bhargavi over music video
178.article_body: A complaint was lodged against Telugu singer Sravana Bhargavi in Tirupati on Saturday over her music video 'Okapari Kokapari'. The song was composed by Annamayya and his followers protested claiming she made the video in an indecent way. Sravana reacted to the protests, saying, "The video has no obscenity...When female singers release a video...some people raise objections and create controversy."

179.title: PFI is like RSS, why do you call them anti-nationals?: RJD leader
179.article_body: In an interview with ANI, Bihar's RJD chief Jagadanand Singh said Islamic terrorist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) is like Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). He added, "They (PFI) also want to serve their community...Why do you call them anti-nationals?" He alleged, "Whenever...security forces [arrested people] as Pakistani agents, all of them were related to RSS and Hindu community."

180.title: 40 students fall sick after eating midday meals at school in K'taka
180.article_body: At least 40 students of Government Higher Primary School in Karnataka's Chitradurga district fell sick after eating the midday meal served at the school on Thursday afternoon. Of the 40 students, 26 of them were hospitalised. The food samples have been sent to a laboratory to ascertain if it was a case of food poisoning, school headmaster Doddappa MC said.

181.title: Gem stones worth ₹94 lakh seized in Chennai, Sri Lankan national held
181.article_body:
Over 1,700 pieces of assorted gem stones worth ₹94.34 lakh were seized at Chennai airport and a Sri Lankan national was arrested in this connection, the customs department said on Saturday. 
Initial examinations revealed that the passenger who arrived from Colombo had swallowed packets containing the precious stones. The officials recovered 56 packets containing gem stones from him.

182.title: Crocodiles enter residential areas in Guj amid rainfall, pics emerge
182.article_body: Crocodiles entered residential areas in Gujarat's Vadodara due to heavy rainfall in the area. Residents living near the bank of Vishwamitri River complained about crocodiles entering their homes, Hindustan Times reported. As per ABP's report, teams deployed by Forest Department have captured 27 crocodiles and have released them in the river. Vishwamitri River is home to more than 250 crocodiles.

183.title: McLaughlin wins 400m hurdles in 50.68s, becomes 1st woman to run under 51s
183.article_body: American Sydney McLaughlin broke her own world record to win a gold medal in 400 metres hurdles at World Championships after finishing the race in 50.68 seconds on Saturday in Oregon. She slashed 0.73 off her previous mark of 51.41 set at Hayward Field last month and became the first woman to run under 51 seconds in the event.

184.title: 3 of a family shot dead while camping in US, suspect kills self
184.article_body: Three members of a family were shot dead during their camping trip to a state park in the US state of Iowa on Friday, police said. The suspected shooter was later found dead with a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the park itself, an official added. He said it could not be ascertained if the suspect had a prior criminal record.

185.title: Cow-calf born with 2 heads due to rare genetic defect in Brazil, pic surfaces
185.article_body: Pictures of a two-headed cow baby born on a farm in Brazil have surfaced online. The calf was born with a serious and very rare genetic defect on July 18 and lived for almost four full days before succumbing to it on July 21. Cattle breeder Elidan said the calf died before it could be taken to a veterinarian.

186.title: Odisha school teacher suspended for molesting 15-yr-old girl student
186.article_body: A teacher of a government-run high school in Odisha's Kendrapara district was suspended on Saturday for allegedly molesting a 15-year-old girl student, officials said. The teenager's father, who filed a complaint, claimed that the girl was molested in the school premises. A case has been registered against the teacher under IPC section 354 (outraging modesty) and POCSO Act.

187.title: 1,000 artefacts missing from Sri Lankan Prez, PM's homes: Police
187.article_body: Over 1,000 valuable artefacts from Sri Lanka's Presidential Palace and Prime Minister's official residence are missing after protesters occupied these premises earlier this month, police said on Saturday. Notably, the Department of Archaeology does not have a detailed record of artefacts at Presidential Palace, a local report said. Special investigation teams have been formed to probe the matter.

188.title: Lufthansa is terrible with handling connecting passengers: Rahul Vaidya
188.article_body: Singer Rahul Vaidya made a series of posts on Instagram Stories criticising Lufthansa Airlines. He wrote, "@lufthansa you are terrible with handling connecting passengers!" In another post, the singer wrote, "After @lufthansa making life hell for us back to our best desi carrier @vistara." Rahul returned to Mumbai with his wife on Saturday after celebrating their first anniversary in London.

189.title: Shinzo Abe's suspected killer to undergo psychiatric evaluation
189.article_body: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's suspected assassin will go through psychiatric evaluation till later this year, local media said on Saturday. A court in Nara Prefecture, where the assassination occurred, agreed to the request for a psychiatric examination. The evaluation will ascertain whether the suspect will be indicted for the shooting.

190.title: How does WHO declare an outbreak a public health emergency?
190.article_body: WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said he's required to consider five elements for declaring an outbreak a global health emergency, as has been done with monkeypox. The information given by nations, the three International Health Regulations criteria and the Emergency Committee's advice are among them. Scientific principles and evidence and finally risk to human health are also considered.

191.title: Sanctions on Russia failed, EU needs new strategy: Hungarian PM
191.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban on Saturday said the EU needs a new strategy for the war in Ukraine as sanctions against Russia have proven ineffective. He said that the strategy should focus on drafting a "good peace proposal" instead of winning the war. Only talks between Russia and the US can establish peace as Moscow wants "security guarantees", he added.

192.title: Man killed, 2 others injured after truck-motorcycle collision in UP
192.article_body: A 22-year-old man was killed on the spot and two others were seriously injured after their motorcycle collided with a speeding truck in the Kokhraj area of UP's Kaushambi district on Saturday, police said. The accident happened when the motorcycle rider tried to negotiate a turn, Kokhraj SHO said. The driver of the truck is absconding, he further informed.

193.title: 22-year-old man found with throat slit inside his home in Agra
193.article_body: A 22-year-old man named Ghanshyam was allegedly killed with his throat slit at his house in Prakash Nagar area of Agra, Uttar Pradesh, police said. Ghanshyam's neighbours found him in a pool of blood on Saturday morning. Ghanshyam lived with his mother. However, he was alone when the incident took place as his mother had gone to a relative's house.

194.title: China, Pakistan agree to welcome an interested 3rd country in CPEC
194.article_body: China and Pakistan have agreed to include "interested" countries in the $60 billion China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), describing it as "an open and inclusive platform" for cooperation. The CPEC is a corridor linking Pakistan's Gwadar Port on the Arabian Sea with Kashgar in China's Xinjiang province. India has protested the CPEC as it passes through Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

195.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till July 27, list released
195.article_body: In its latest bulletin, the IMD issued heavy to very rainfall warning for several states till July 27. It is very likely in Telangana till July 27. It's also very likely over Chhattisgarh and MP till July 26. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Odisha on July 24 & 25. It's likely over West Bengal and Sikkim on July 27.

196.title: 63 lakh Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity: UN agency
196.article_body: UN's World Food Programme (WFP) on Saturday said that around 63 lakh Sri Lankans are facing food insecurity amid the severe economic crisis in the country, ANI reported. The UN agency further said that it has been able to raise only 30% of the $63 million it needs to provide emergency food supplies to 30 lakh people till December 2022.

197.title: Matter of time before Kohli gets back in form: Anjum Chopra
197.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra said she's sure the India batter is doing everything to regain his form. "A player like him must be trying and trying to get out of the slump...I'm sure that it will be a matter of time that he will be back among runs for the Indian team," she added.

198.title: Sushmita represents empowered Indian woman: Pooja on 'gold digger' comments
198.article_body: Actress Pooja Bedi spoke in support of Sushmita Sen after the latter was called a "gold digger" over her relationship with Lalit Modi. She said, "She represents the emancipated, empowered Indian woman that we should all admire." Pooja further said that Sushmita has set the stage for a progressive change as we emerge from a patriarchal, sexist and ageist era.

199.title: Union Home Ministry transfers probe in Bihar PFI case to NIA
199.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) transferred the probe into the Popular Front Of India (PFI) "terror module" case to the NIA on Friday. Earlier this month, two individuals with links to the PFI were arrested from Bihar's capital Patna for their alleged involvement in "anti-India" activities. A third individual was later arrested from Lucknow in connection with the case.

200.title: I got confidence of death bowling from Rajasthan Royals: Chahal
200.article_body: Crediting Rajasthan Royals for giving him confidence of bowling in the death overs, India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said his IPL team gave him a role which helped him to bowl two-three overs after the 40-over mark in ODIs. Chasing 309, West Indies managed 305/6 in 50 overs in the first ODI. Chahal dismissed batter Brandon King(54) in the 45th over.

201.title: 6 students hospitalised after lightning strike near J'khand school
201.article_body: Six students were hospitalised following a lightning strike near the premises of a government school in the Bokaro district of Jharkhand on Saturday, as per authorities. Out of the 50 students who complained of complications after the incident, six were found to be mildly serious and were hospitalised, an official said. Two of those six students lost consciousness, he added.

202.title: Having women's cricket in multi-nation event can be game changer: Harmanpreet
202.article_body: Ahead of Commonwealth Games 2022, India Women limited-overs captain Harmanpreet Kaur said that having women's cricket in the multi-nation event can be a game changer. Notably, women's cricket is making its debut at Commonwealth Games. "This tournament is very important for us and this time we are playing for a medal," she added. The Games will begin on July 28.

203.title: Assam govt approves 2nd wildlife sanctuary in Barak Valley
203.article_body: The Assam government has approved the setting up of a second wildlife sanctuary in the state's Barak Valley, which is home to a multitude of birds and mammals. The Barak Bhuban Wildlife Sanctuary will be spread over an area of 320 sq km between the Barak river and the Sonai river. The valley is already home to Borail Wildlife Sanctuary.

204.title: There was blood coming out of his eyes: Aasif on 'Bhabi Ji...' actor Deepesh's death
204.article_body: Actor Aasif Sheikh, speaking about 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan's death, said, "There was blood coming out of his eyes, it's a clear sign of brain haemorrhage." "He must have not eaten anything in...morning, while playing cricket...his blood pressure must have increased...He immediately fell down," Aasif added. "After 40, you should...not exert yourself too much," he stated.

205.title: English cricketer Northeast smashes 410* in a first-class innings, sets multiple records
205.article_body: English batter Sam Northeast, while playing for Glamorgan against Leicestershire in County Championship, slammed 410*(450) in his team's first innings. He's the ninth batter in first-class cricket to score 400 runs in an innings and the first since Brian Lara in 2004. He became the first-ever Glamorgan cricketer to cross 400. Northeast's 410* is the third-highest score in county history.

206.title: PM posts pics of sky beam light Digital Jyot in Delhi for tributes to freedom fighters
206.article_body: PM Narendra Modi posted pictures of a sky beam light named 'Digital Jyot' that has been installed in Delhi's Central Park and urged people to pay tributes to freedom fighters. People can pay their tributes via digitaltribute.in and the same will be displayed, along with their names and pictures, at the LED screen in front of the 'Digital Jyot'.

207.title: Relative accuses woman of practising witchcraft, kills her in Ranchi
207.article_body: A 31-year-old woman named Seema Devi was beaten to death by her 35-year-old relative on Saturday in Ranchi, Jharkhand, police said. The accused, Baso Devi, had allegedly hit Seema with an iron rod. Police said she alleged that Seema practised witchcraft due to which some villagers had died. However, police suspect that the case is linked to a property dispute.

208.title: Monkeypox declared a global health emergency by WHO
208.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared monkeypox as a global health emergency. Around 65 countries have reported outbreaks of the viral disease as confirmed cases near 16,000. Monkeypox virus is transmitted from one person to another by close contact with lesions, body fluids, respiratory droplets and contaminated materials such as bedding, according to the WHO.

209.title: In difficult times, India's efforts were praised globally: Outgoing Prez
209.article_body: In his farewell speech in the Parliament on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "World is struggling because of...pandemic. I hope we learn lessons from the pandemic, we forgot that we're all part of nature." "In difficult times, India's efforts were praised all across the world," he added. PM Narendra Modi and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu attended the ceremony.

210.title: 4 persons trapped in flash flood rescued in J&K's Udhampur
210.article_body: Four persons trapped in a flash flood in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district were rescued in a joint operation by police and SDRF, officials said on Saturday. Four persons identified as Sanjeev Kumar, Mulkh Raj, Ajay Kumar and Sushil Kumar were rescued from the flash flood in the Barmeen nallah after locals informed the police post in Roundomail, they said.

211.title: Will act after verdict is out: TMC as ED arrests Bengal minister Partha
211.article_body: Following West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's arrest by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in an alleged teacher recruitment scam, TMC leader Firhad Hakim said the party will act "after the judiciary comes out with its verdict". "We're watching the situation and have faith in the judiciary. TMC will not tolerate any discrepancy or malpractice in party or in government," he added.

212.title: People's money being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal: Scindia
212.article_body: After West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested by Enforcement Directorate (ED), Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said his arrest is evidence of the fact that how people's money is being sacrificed for corruption in Bengal. "People will get to completely know about it, I'm confident," Scindia said. Partha Chatterjee was arrested in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam.

213.title: Parliament is a temple of democracy: Outgoing President Kovind
213.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, in his farewell address to parliamentarians, termed Parliament a "temple of democracy". "As in any family, sometimes there are differences of opinion even in Parliament," he said. "But we're all members of the 'Parliament family' whose top priority is to continue working in the interest of the big joint family of the nation," President Kovind added.

214.title: Holiday declared in Telangana's Medak after heavy rains kill 3
214.article_body: At least three persons were killed due to heavy rains in Telangana's Medak after which District Collector S Harish announced a holiday as several places were cut off due to overflowing water. Police said two migrant workers from Bihar died after a wall collapsed in Reddypally village on Saturday. Another person drowned in floodwater in Vallabhapur, police added.

215.title: MPs should always follow Gandhian philosophy: Prez in farewell speech
215.article_body: During his farewell address on Saturday, President Ram Nath Kovind said, "MPs should always follow the Gandhian philosophy while exercising rights of debate and dissent in Parliament." "Mahatma Gandhi used peace and non-violence to instil harmony...we must adopt his ways," he added. The President further urged political parties to "rise above partisan politics" in national interest.

216.title: Maoist arrested in Jharkhand's Latehar, arms & ammunition seized
216.article_body: Police on Saturday said that 28-year-old Adesh Ganjhu alias Mangra, a member of the banned Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee, was arrested in Jharkhand's Latehar district in an anti-Maoist operation. "A huge cache of arms and ammunition was recovered during the operation. This is for the first time that ultra-modern 40 mm HE grenades have been seized," Latehar SP said.

217.title: Shot putter Tajinder Toor excluded from CWG 2022 due to injury: AFI
217.article_body: Shot putter Tajinder Toor has been excluded from the Commonwealth Games 2022 squad due to an injury, stated Athletics Federation of India (AFI) on Saturday. Toor had sustained a groin injury in Chula Vista in USA where the Indian team had a brief training stint before ongoing World Championships. The 27-year-old didn't participate in the tournament in Oregon.

218.title: Pune boy secures 81% in CBSE Class 12 exams while fighting cancer
218.article_body: A 17-year-old boy from Pune, who was diagnosed with leukaemia six months ago, has secured 81% in the Class 12 CBSE exams. Ojas Dhankar, who suffered from nausea after chemotherapy sessions in the run-up to the exams, thanked his family, particularly his mother, for support. "It is a situation you're thrown into and I did whatever I could," said Dhankar.

219.title: 18-month-old girl mowed down as father reversed truck in B'luru
219.article_body: An 18-month-old girl was mowed down by her father's reversing truck in Bengaluru's Kammanahalli on Friday. As per a report, Monika Devi was playing outside her house when the truck's mudguard knocked her down. She sustained serious head injuries and was rushed to a hospital. However, she died later. Her father, Balakrishna, is a supplier of construction materials in Karnataka.

220.title: BMC doctors warn of mass-bunk from Aug 1 to protest more workload
220.article_body: Around 1,500 resident doctors of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) hospitals have warned they'll skip duty from August 1 to protest the increased workload due to a shortage of staff. Every six months, the BMC recruits 188 senior resident doctors but the last recruitment has not taken place. Further, the contract of 188 senior resident doctors will end on July 31.

221.title: Pune district records dip in active COVID-19 cases
221.article_body: As per officials, the Pune district is recording a dip in the numbers of COVID-19 cases and active cases. However, the district continues to record the highest weekly positivity rate across Maharashtra. On Friday, the district reported 857 COVID-19 cases, including 506 from Pune Municipal Corporation limits. In total, Maharashtra on Friday reported 2,515 COVID-19 cases and six deaths.

222.title: 25-year-old man electrocuted near storm-water drain in Bengaluru
222.article_body: A 25-year-old man died due to electrocution while allegedly trying to escape after stealing iron rods from an under-construction building near a storm-water drain adjoining Bengaluru's Ulsoor Lake. Police, who rushed to the site and recovered the body, said the man got electrocuted when the iron rods he was carrying came in contact with an electric wire.

223.title: Details of BCCI's non-cricket expenditure of ₹22 crore in last 2 years surface
223.article_body: The BCCI tabled the break-up of its non-cricket expenditure in the last two years at the apex council meeting. The non-cricket expenditure added up to ₹22 crore, including ₹18 crore for Olympic expenses. The BCCI paid ₹70 lakh to singer Mohit Chauhan for India's official theme song for Tokyo Olympics. The BCCI spent ₹98 lakh for Olympics campaign T-shirts.

224.title: Model Arpita, aide of WB minister Partha, arrested after ₹20cr found at her home
224.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday arrested model and actress Arpita Mukherjee, a close aide of arrested West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. This came a day after the agency said it found ₹20 crore from her residence during raids in connection to the state's School Service Commission (SSC) teacher recruitment scam. Chatterjee was sent to two days of ED custody.

225.title: S Korea to lift its decades-long ban on N Korean newspapers, TV shows
225.article_body: A South Korean official on Friday said that South Korea plans to lift its decades-long ban on public access to North Korean TV shows, newspapers and other publications. The move is part of its efforts to promote mutual understanding between the rivals, the official added. Notably, this comes despite tensions between the two countries over North Korea's recent missile tests.

226.title: Alcaraz will be much better player than me but Nadal is a big word: Ferrer
226.article_body: Ex-world number three David Ferrer said his Spanish compatriot Carlos Alcaraz is a great player, adding he's going to reach number one and win Grand Slams. On comparisons between Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal, Ferrer said that 22-time Grand Slam champion is a "big word". Ferrer further said that the 19-year-old will undoubtedly be a much better tennis player than him.

227.title: UP Police distribute helmets to Kanwariyas on bikes in GB Nagar
227.article_body: The police deployed on Kanwar Yatra duty in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar have distributed helmets and national flags to Kanwariyas on two-wheelers. The police have also set up a control room in Noida to facilitate the movement of Kanwariyas through the city. Police personnel have been instructed to immediately help the devotees in case of any problems, an official said.

228.title: Mulund residents file police complaint against property developer
228.article_body: Residents of Tirumala Habitats in Mumbai's Mulund suburb have filed a police complaint against the 40-storey building's property developer, alleging poor conditions of basic facilities. Tirumala Habitats has 415 flats, ranging from ₹2.25 crore to ₹5.5 crore. Residents said the electric work is done poorly, the lift often malfunctions and safety glasses are missing on higher floors.

229.title: President Ram Nath Kovind delivers farewell speech in Parliament
229.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, whose term is set to end on Saturday, addressed the Parliament for the last time as he was given a farewell. He recalled the key moments of his five-year tenure and also congratulated his successor and President-elect Droupadi Murmu on winning the election. Murmu will take oath as the President of India on Monday.

230.title: 4-year-old girl raped by 22-year-old man in UP village: Police
230.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 22-year-old man named Farid in a village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday night, police said. According to police complaint, the girl was playing outside her house when the accused lured her and took her to a secluded place, where he raped her. The girl is said to be in a critical condition.

231.title: I'd called him days before death, we couldn't talk: Sidharth's cousin Aditya
231.article_body: Late actor Sidharth Shukla's cousin actor Aditya Shukla has revealed that he called the former days before his death. "I had called him but he was busy with his work so we couldn't talk. I wish we had spoken that day," Aditya said. He further said that he was inspired to join the industry after looking at Sidharth's career.

232.title: Kejriwal to visit HP to administer oath to over 5,000 AAP workers
232.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal will visit Himachal Pradesh on Monday to administer oath to more than 5,000 officer bearers of AAP in Solan, ANI reported. Kejriwal will be accompanied by Punjab CM and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann. This comes ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Earlier, AAP organised a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Palampur.

233.title: 13-yr-old girl abducted, raped in Chhattisgarh; 3 arrested
233.article_body: Three people, including a minor, have been arrested after a 13-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped in Chhattisgarh's Korea district. According to police, the minor boy abducted the girl on July 11 and raped her. Later, on July 14, he along with the other two accused took the girl to a godown and raped her, an officer said.

234.title: See you in court of law & court of people: Irani to Congress over allegations on daughter
234.article_body: Hitting out at Congress for allegations against her daughter Zoish, Smriti Irani said, "Her character was publicly mutilated by Congress spokespeople." She called the allegations against Zoish "malicious" and said, "I'll see you (Congress leaders) in the court of law and in the court of people." Congress earlier held a press conference alleging Zoish's restaurant had an illegal bar license.

235.title: We have to be grateful for push for diversity in Hollywood: Farhan
235.article_body: Farhan Akhtar stated that we have to be "very grateful" for the push for diversity happening within storytelling in Hollywood. "How many actors or people from India were working in other parts of the world 10 or 15 years ago? That has changed...Irrfan...Om Puri...Priyanka (Chopra) is doing exceedingly well and Alia (Bhatt) is also doing a film now," he said.

236.title: Ghaziabad Police busts NCR gang accused of stealing 300 vehicles
236.article_body: Four members of an inter-state vehicle robbery gang suspected of stealing over 300 cars, motorcycles etc. from the Delhi-NCR region were arrested by Ghaziabad Police on Thursday. The gang's leader was arrested from Hint Crossroad in Kavinagar, police said. Based on his interrogation, Ghaziabad Police raided a godown in Sonepat and arrested three other accused, police added.

237.title: India Women should take no team lightly at CWG 2022: Anjum Chopra
237.article_body: Ex-India Women captain Anjum Chopra has said India Women should take no team lightly at Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, adding all teams are great. She further said, "In T20I and 50-over format, the key difference is that anyone can have a good day." India will face Australia in their first match of Group A on July 29.

238.title: Irani denies 'illegal' Goa bar is run by daughter, says 'she's a college student'
238.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Saturday denied claims that her 18-year-old daughter Zoish was running a restaurant with an alleged illegal bar license. Irani said her daughter is leading life as an "ordinary college student", adding, "Her only fault is that her mother fought elections against Rahul Gandhi from Amethi." She said her daughter's "character was assassinated by Congressmen".

239.title: Yeida allots 37 plots in Medical Devices Park in Greater Noida
239.article_body: The Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (Yeida) on Friday allotted plots to 37 medical device manufacturers through a lottery in its upcoming Medical Devices Park in Greater Noida Sector 28. Yeida will earn revenues worth ₹50.08 crore from the sale of these plots, the authority said. According to Yeida, 39 companies qualified for the draw after scrutiny of 173 applicants.

240.title: Angry villagers in K'taka make buffalo inaugurate bus shelter
240.article_body: Upset with the authorities for not restoring the village's old collapsed bus shelter, locals in Karnataka's Balehosur built a temporary one with coconut fronds. In protest, they made a buffalo inaugurate it instead of a politician. "It's been two years, we've been requesting the local MLA and MP to restore the bus shelter...but nothing was ever done," the villagers alleged.

241.title: Russian airstrikes on Odesa after grain deal outrageous: US envoy
241.article_body: Russia should be held to account for the "outrageous" airstrikes on the Ukrainian port city of Odesa on Saturday, the US ambassador to Kyiv, Bridget Brink, said. The strikes came less than 24 hours after Russia and Ukraine signed a deal to reopen Black Sea ports and resume grain exports. The Kremlin is continuing to "weaponise food", Brink added.

242.title: Will Sisodia too lose memory?: Anurag amid row over Delhi Excise Policy
242.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of shielding the "corrupt" after LG VK Saxena recommended a CBI probe into the Delhi Excise Policy. "There were allegations against Satyendar Jain who lost his memory in jail. Will Manish Sisodia too lose memory?" Thakur stated. "AAP government has set new records of corruption," he further said.

243.title: Don't want to be construed as somebody who misuses surname: Arjun Kapoor
243.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said he doesn't want to be construed as somebody who misuses his surname or his lineage. "I'll not disown where I'm from but I'll never misuse it," he added. "I'm somebody who's very, very aware that I'm blessed. And, I'll never, ever misuse it to put somebody down or take somebody else's opportunity away," said Arjun.

244.title: Man held for cheating people on pretext of real estate business in Hyd
244.article_body: The Cyber Crimes division of Rachakonda Police arrested 38-year-old Salavadi Nagaraju for allegedly cheating people on pretext of real estate business, police tweeted on Saturday. A complaint was registered by a Hyderabad resident, who was allegedly cheated of over ₹52,000 by Nagaraju, who claimed to sell a property. A total of 15 cases have been registered against Nagaraju, police said.

245.title: B'luru woman shares video of road with '40 potholes in 200 m stretch'
245.article_body: A video showing a biker riding through multiple potholes on a road in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media. Describing it as an off-roading experience in the city, Twitter user Ankita Banerjee claimed that the 200 m stretch of road has 40 potholes. Reportedly, the video is of a road near Spice Garden Layout at Marathahalli in the city.

246.title: Video shows sinkhole opening under swimming pool that killed a man during party in Israel
246.article_body: A video of the moment a massive sinkhole opened up underneath a swimming pool in Israel during a party, that left a man dead, has surfaced online. Footage showed the hole suddenly appearing and the water receding. The body of the 32-year-old man was discovered hours later at the bottom of the 43-foot-deep hole, said officials.

247.title: Paparazzi call male celebs 'sir', female celebs by name: Tara Sutaria
247.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria stated that a lot of paparazzi videos show them addressing male celebrities as 'sir' and female celebrities by their name. "We're all very young, we don't want to be called 'ma'am' or 'ji'...but it's this general sense of 'the man...must be given more respect'," she said. Tara added that changing small things like these "could move mountains".

248.title: Dialect coach for 'Good...' made me practice 'Lagawelu Jab Lipastic': Janhvi
248.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor has said her dialect coach made her practice the Bhojpuri song 'Lagawelu Jab Lipastic' during her training for 'Good Luck Jerry'. "[It's] an amazing song," she added. "People of Bihar are real fun and their way of talking has a certain...sweetness to it," said Janhvi, who plays the role of a girl from Bihar in the upcoming film.

249.title: Angelina wins legal battle against ex-husband Brad over French winery
249.article_body: Actress Angelina Jolie has won the legal battle against her ex-husband actor Brad Pitt over the Chateau Miraval winery where they got married. They had bought the winery in 2008 for an estimated $28.3 million. Brad filed the case claiming they had agreed not to sell their interests in the company but Angelina sold it to the Stoli Group.

250.title: Monarch butterfly added to international list of threatened species
250.article_body: The migratory black and orange monarch butterfly has been placed in the endangered category of the International Union for Conservation of Nature's Red List of Threatened Species. The butterfly is threatened with extinction because of habitat destruction and climate change, conservationists said on Thursday. Planet Earth is currently undergoing sixth mass extinction driven by human activity.

251.title: IMD predicts moderate to heavy rainfall in Hyd, yellow alert issued
251.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for moderate to heavy rainfall in the next 48 hours in Hyderabad and parts of Telangana. Hyderabad Traffic Police urged people to stay indoors as due to water logging, there is a possibility of heavy traffic congestion. GHMC and Disaster Response Force (DRF) personnel have been deployed on ground.

252.title: Flash floods kill at least 17 peo­ple in south­ern Iran, 6 missing
252.article_body: At least 17 people have died and six others are missing after heavy rains caused flooding in Iran's southern province of Fars, state television said on Saturday. About 55 people were rescued in the flood which submerged 15 cars, officials added. The country's metrology department had warned about heavy seasonal rainfall across Iran, which is facing a decades-long drought.

253.title: Saudi Police arrests man who helped Jewish reporter sneak into Mecca
253.article_body: The police in Saudi Arabia said that they have arrested a Saudi man who helped an Israeli-Jewish reporter sneak into Mecca in explicit violation of regulations prohibiting the entry of non-Muslims. Gil Tamary had filmed himself in Mecca for a roughly 10-minute-long segment that aired on Monday in which he visited a key site on the hajj pilgrimage route.

254.title: Superb my superhero friend: Suniel on Ajay's National Award
254.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty took to Twitter on Saturday to congratulate Ajay Devgn on winning the Best Actor National Award for the film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "AJ! Superb show my superhero friend. You kept your word to celebrate our unsung heroes even more proudly," he wrote. "Congrats on the National Award for #Tanhaji," Suniel added with the hashtag "Proud".

255.title: Man hit by local train at Mumbai's Kandivali station, dies
255.article_body: A man died after being hit by a local train at Mumbai's Kandivali station, an official from the Government Railway Police (GRP) said on Friday. "We're trying to establish the victim's identity...[and] track...two others who were seen accompanying him in the CCTV footage," the official said. The victim was critically wounded and died at a hospital, the official added.

256.title: Working on getting Olympics back to London: Mayor Sadiq Khan
256.article_body: London Mayor Sadiq Khan has said that his office is working on the city to get a chance to host the Olympic Games again. "The great thing about London is you don't expend carbon on building new stadiums...because we've got all the kit," Khan said. He added that the plan is in the early stages and would require government support.

257.title: Andhra gets a new floating solar power plant on Meghadri Gedda reservoir
257.article_body: The Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation has commissioned a floating solar power plant at Meghadri Gedda reservoir in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. G Lakshmisha, Commissioner of GVMC, said that the power plant can produce 4.2 million units of power each year. "Besides that, we're also saving 54,000 tonnes of coal per year and reducing emissions by 3,022 tonnes per year," he added.

258.title: BMC to distribute 50 lakh national flags under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
258.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to distribute 50 lakh national flags to residents and institutions in Mumbai, as part of the Centre's 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Free distribution of flags is meant to encourage better response, a BMC official said. The BMC has also decided to have a laser show from August 13 to 15 at Marine Drive.

259.title: Mark Cuban reveals his worst Shark Tank investment, says 'all of the money is gone'
259.article_body: Billionaire Mark Cuban recently revealed that the worst investment deal he made on 'Shark Tank' was Breathometer. Cuban invested in the smartphone breathalyser after Charles Michael Yim pitched the idea in 2013. "I'd look at [Yim's] Instagram and he'd be in Bora Bora...Two weeks later, he'd be in Vegas...Next thing you know, all of the money is gone," Cuban said.

260.title: China releases high-resolution pic of Mars' largest moon Phobos that looks like a potato
260.article_body: China released a high-resolution image of Mars' largest moon Phobos on Saturday, marking the two-year anniversary of the launch of its Mars probe Tianwen-1. In the picture, Phobos can be seen as an irregularly shaped object like a potato. Öpik, an impact crater on Phobos named after Estonian astronomer and astrophysicist Ernst Öpik, can also be seen.

261.title: Passengers jump out as train catches fire over river in US, videos surface
261.article_body: Several videos of people jumping out of a train that caught fire on a bridge in the US have surfaced online. Passengers of a Boston Orange Line train were seen smashing windows to jump out on the tracks after a massive fire that broke out over the Mystic River in Massachusetts on Thursday (July 21). The train had 200 passengers.

262.title: That's my most favourite thing in the world: Ranbir on if he procrastinates
262.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor in an interview was asked if he procrastinates, to which the actor replied, "That's my most favourite thing in the world, just to sit and think about nothing." Ranbir currently stars in 'Shamshera', an action-adventure film directed by Karan Malhotra. He will next be seen in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra'.

263.title: Wife called and was bawling, I started crying too: Siddharth on National Award
263.article_body: Actor Siddharth Menon said that his wife called him after he won a National Award. "She called me and started crying. She was bawling. I couldn't resist and I cried as well. If she cries, I lose it. She is the one, who has seen me so closely through the process of making this film," he added.

264.title: Really well done epic, very powerful story: 'Avengers...' co-maker on RRR
264.article_body: Filmmaker Joe Russo, who is a co-director of 'Avengers: Endgame', said, "'RRR' was a [really] well done epic, (with) nice strong themes [and] great visuals." "[It] was a great movie...and [had] a really powerful story about brotherhood," added Joe. Discussing 'RRR', 'Piranha' director Joe Dante had said, "There's [never] been a more brutal portrait of the horrors of British colonisation."

265.title: I don't have the audacity: Janhvi on picking a Sridevi film for remake
265.article_body: Talking about a film starring her late mother and actress Sridevi which she'd pick for a remake, actress Janhvi Kapoor said, "I don't have the audacity to pick any of her films and be in a remake." "What she...[did] in each of her films is fully untouchable," she added. "[My life with mom around] was a fantasy," Janhvi had stated.

266.title: TMC has emerged as party of thieves under Mamata's leadership: BJP MP
266.article_body: BJP MP and Vice President of party's West Bengal unit Saumitra Khan on Saturday criticised CM Mamata Banerjee over the arrest of minister Partha Chatterjee in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. "Tomorrow Firhad Hakim will be arrested, then Abhishek Banerjee," Khan stated. "TMC has emerged as...party of thieves and scamsters under the leadership of Mamata Banerjee," he added.

267.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad civic body hires transgender persons as security guards
267.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has recruited over 30 transgender persons as security guards and green marshals. "We are hopeful that this opportunity will certainly help them in creating their own identity and live with dignity," Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil said. "We also have plans to empower the transgender community members by providing financial support to them," he added.

268.title: 7 days after retirement, US sprinter Felix called back at World Championships
268.article_body: Seven days after retirement, US sprinter Allyson Felix has been called back at World Championships to race in the preliminaries of the women's 4×400 relay on Saturday in Oregon. The seven-time Olympic gold medallist ran in what she had said was her last major race on July 15, helping US win a bronze medal in the mixed relay.

269.title: UP man kills 5-yr-old niece for demanding mango while he was eating
269.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly killing his five-year-old niece for repeatedly demanding a mango while he ate his meal. Reportedly, the accused panicked and slit the girl's throat when she started bleeding after he hit her with a rod. The body of the deceased, who'd gone missing on Tuesday afternoon, was found at the accused's home later at night.

270.title: Climate crisis threatens 70% marine life in biodiversity-rich areas: Experts
270.article_body: Over 70% of marine life in the most biodiversity-rich areas of Earth's ocean is threatened by climate change, experts said. "Research shows that locations with exceptionally high marine biodiversity are...most exposed to future oceanic warming," said Dr Stuart Brown. "This is because species living in these...regions are generally ill-equipped to respond to large changes in temperature," he added.

271.title: Video of B'luru parents driving on footpaths goes viral, police react
271.article_body: A video of parents driving two-wheelers with their children riding pillion on footpaths to avoid traffic in Bengaluru has gone viral. The video was reportedly shot at St Patrick's Complex. Reacting to it, Ashoknagar Traffic Police Station tweeted, "[We've informed] the sector officer and patrolling CoBRA to take action against violators." A netizen said, "Sad…teaching the kids wrong things."

272.title: 1st segment of Pune's 3rd Metro line erected at Hinjewadi
272.article_body: The first segment of Pune's third Metro line, being developed by the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority, was erected at Hinjewadi on Friday. The segment weighs 46 tonnes and is erected at a height of 11 metres between proposed station number 01 and 02 on the 23-kilometre elevated Hinjewadi-Shivajinagar line. "Around 10-12 such segments...used between two pillars," an official said.

273.title: US bans ex-Paraguay President Cartes from entering the country
273.article_body: The US has imposed a travel ban on Paraguay's ex-President Horacio Cartes, accusing him of corruption and links to "terrorist" groups. Cartes, who served as President from 2013 to 2018, had "obstructed a major international probe into transnational crime in order to protect himself and his criminal associate from potential prosecution and political damage," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said.

274.title: Putin's spit into the face of UN chief, Turkish Prez: Ukraine on Russia's missile attack
274.article_body: Russia attacked Odesa sea port less than 24 hours after signing an agreement aimed at restarting Ukrainian grain exports from Odesa and two other Black Sea locations. After the attack, Ukraine said the missile strike was "Vladimir Putin's spit into the face" of UN chief António Guterres and Turkish President Recep Erdogan, "who put enormous efforts into reaching the accord".

275.title: SpaceX breaks its annual record with 32nd rocket launch of 2022
275.article_body: Elon Musk’s SpaceX on Friday broke its record for the number of rockets launched in a year. While the company managed 31 launches in 2021, it aims to launch 52 missions in 2022. SpaceX's 32nd launch of 2022 on Friday deployed 46 Starlink satellites to low-Earth orbit. Notably, SpaceX so far has launched nearly 3,000 Starlink satellites to space.

276.title: People ask 'Why is she in the film?': Vaani Kapoor on 'Shamshera'
276.article_body: Talking about actor Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera' which released yesterday, actress Vaani Kapoor who stars in the film said, "[People] ask, 'Why is she in this film?'" "People want to know my credibility," added Vaani. "Opportunities [didn't] knock on my door. [Yet], people said, 'She is lucky!'" she stated. "I am the underdog...I am trying to prove who I'm," she said.

277.title: Father catches man who snatched daughter's gold chain in Chandigarh
277.article_body: A father caught a man who snatched his seven-year-old daughter's gold locket after an about 100-metre chase in Chandigarh. "My daughter was crying and all I could think of was getting her locket back," the father said. The father handed over the accused to the police after informing them. The locket was recovered from the pocket of the accused's trousers.

278.title: I wanted them to hit me over the covers: Chahal on 1st ODI vs WI
278.article_body: Team India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said he wanted the West Indies batters to hit him over the covers in the first ODI. "I was...bowling wider because the leg-side boundary was small," added Chahal. Talking about the last over where Mohammed Siraj defended 15 runs, Chahal stated, "There was confidence...but also pressure...When Sanju Samson made that save...it raised our confidence."

279.title: Anti-encroachment drive on land worth ₹40 cr conducted in Greater Noida
279.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) conducted an anti-encroachment drive against illegal constructions in Sunpura village on Friday on land worth ₹40 crore, officials said. This comes after GNIDA was informed that some people were found building illegal colonies and houses in an area of about 20,000 square metres. "The land lies within GNIDA's notified area," an official said.

280.title: 7 of 19 workers who went missing near China border found
280.article_body: Seven of the 19 construction workers from Assam who went missing near China border in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey district, were found and rescued by an Indian Air Force helicopter, said police on Saturday. They were given food and medicines, said an official. Search is on for the remaining workers, for which an IAF helicopter has been deployed.

281.title: Will try to play all 3 formats for as long as possible: Bairstow
281.article_body: After England all-rounder Ben Stokes announced retirement from ODIs citing difficulties to manage workload, teammate Jonny Bairstow has said that he will try to play all three formats for as long as possible. "I don't see myself making a choice [in the near future]...I'm loving being a part of all three squads. They are all different in themselves," Bairstow said.

282.title: A combination of Ranji winners should be fielded in Irani Cup: Ex-India player
282.article_body: Former cricketer Karsan Ghavri has proposed a combined team that consists of players from 2021-22 and 2019-20 Ranji winning squads, namely Madhya Pradesh and Saurashtra, should be fielded in this year's Irani Cup. "It is only fair that the BCCI picks a...squad consisting [seven players from both sides]," Ghavri said. Notably, the Irani Cup 2019-20 wasn't held due to COVID-19.

283.title: 2 CPI(M) workers held in connection with attack on RSS office in Kerala
283.article_body: Police arrested two CPI(M) workers, aged 23 and 27, in connection with the attack on Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) office in Kerala's Payyannur area last week. "As per the preliminary investigation, they both have direct participation in the attack," police said. The incident was caught on CCTV showing several explosions within the boundary wall of the RSS office.

284.title: Centre decides whom to arrest first, then builds 'fake' case: Kejriwal
284.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said there is a new system in India wherein the Centre decides whom to arrest first and then builds a "fake and fabricated" case. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is going to be arrested soon, possibly in three-four days, Kejriwal claimed. This comes after Delhi LG ordered a CBI probe into alleged violation of Delhi Excise Policy.

285.title: 17-yr-old boy beaten for not chanting 'Jai Shri Ram' in Hyd: Police
285.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was allegedly beaten up in Hyderabad for refusing to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' during a Bonalu (a Hindu festival) procession on Thursday, police said. A group of miscreants had allegedly stopped the victim and told him to chant 'Jai Shri Ram' which he refused to do, police added. The victim is a resident of Hussaini Alam.

286.title: I have a 7-month-old baby girl, she spent 15 days in NICU: Sangita Ghosh
286.article_body: Actress Sangita Ghosh, known for portraying Swaran in television show 'Swaran Ghar', has revealed that she has a seven-month-old baby. Sangita said her daughter Devi was born prematurely on December 25 and was in the NICU for around 15 days. "It's not that we hid the news...we decided not to talk about it till...the time was right," the actress added.

287.title: US announces additional $270 million military aid for Ukraine
287.article_body: The US has announced an additional $270 million in military aid to Ukraine. The aid includes four new M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems and 580 Phoenix Ghost drones. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy thanked US President Joe Biden for the package. These "powerful arms will save our soldiers' lives, speed up...liberation of our land from the Russian aggressor", Zelenskyy said.

288.title: Truck loses balance in Nuh amid rains, rams into autorickshaw; 7 dead
288.article_body: Seven people died while four others were injured after a truck allegedly collided with an autorickshaw in Haryana's Nuh on Friday. "It appears that due to heavy rain, the truck lost balance and collided with the auto, which fell into ditch. The truck also lost balance and overturned and fell on top of the auto, which was crushed," police said.

289.title: Tiger survives after being swept away by strong river currents in UP, video goes viral
289.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a tiger surviving strong river currents in Uttar Pradesh. The tiger was swept away by strong currents while trying to cross the Gerua river in Bahraich district. Using its own strength, the tiger managed to swim to the other side and reach the forest of Katarniaghat.

290.title: If you don't like it, don't look at it: Swara Bhasker on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
290.article_body: Swara Bhasker took to Twitter on Friday to write about Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot. "Daily cases of injustice & oppression in India, but sure... our outrage is reserved for Ranveer Singh's photos!" she wrote. "I mean, seriously...don't like it, don't look at it! Not your cup of tea, don't drink it! But don't 'thopo' your preferences on us!" Swara added.

291.title: BCCI to trial BoneXpert software to detect age fraud among cricketers, to cut cost by 80%
291.article_body: The BCCI will use BoneXpert software on an experimental basis to detect age fraud among cricketers with an aim to cut cost by 80%. The BCCI currently uses TW3 method for age determination. The current method costs ₹2,400/bone test and takes about 3-4 days while the proposed usage of BoneXpert software will give instantaneous result and costs only ₹288.

292.title: Someone please make a film on Geeta Dutt and cast me: Sobhita
292.article_body: Actress Sobhita Dhulipala took to Instagram Stories on Friday to appeal filmmakers to cast her in a film made on late playback singer Geeta Dutt. She shared a video montage of the singer's pictures, writing, "Been saying it in every interview since 2016. Geeta Dutt and Amrita Shergil. I am their biggest fan and am nearly possessed by their spirit."

293.title: Bharatpur seer who set self on fire in protest over mining dies
293.article_body: A seer who set himself on fire in Rajasthan's Bharatpur in a protest against mining at certain hills considered sacred by some has died while undergoing treatment in Delhi. The state government had announced earlier that the area will be declared as forest land following the incident. The seer's mortal remains are being taken to Barsana for last rites.

294.title: Kerala fishermen find 28 kg 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in sea
294.article_body: A group of fishermen from Vizhinjam in Thiruvananthapuram who found 28.4 kg of ambergris or 'whale vomit' worth ₹28 crore in the sea, handed it over to the Kerala Coastal Police. The ambergris was later collected by Kerala Forest Department after police informed them. Ambergris, which is produced in the digestive system of sperm whales, is used to manufacture perfumes.

295.title: Johnny Depp counters Amber Heard's defamation case verdict appeal with his own
295.article_body: A day after Amber Heard filed a notice to appeal the verdict of the defamation case won by Johnny Depp, he filed his own to counter the $2 million he was directed to pay her. Heard's team had filed the notice to appeal the verdict directing her to pay $10 million to Depp by the jury of a Virginia court.

296.title: If we're celebrating Alia-Ranbir, we should celebrate Sushmita-Lalit: Lopamudra
296.article_body: Actress Lopamudra Raut said that it is unfair to be celebrating Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor but not Susmita Sen and Lalit Modi. "No one has the right to comment on her relationship. If we are celebrating Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor or Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh, we should celebrate Sushmita [Sen] and Lalit [Modi] too," she added.

297.title: BJP won more seats under Yediyurappa: Shivakumar after ex-CM vacates seat
297.article_body: After ex-Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa announced his decision to vacate the Shikaripura assembly seat for his son BY Vijayendra, Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that the BJP leader should not announce retirement as he "still has political strength". "The BJP has won more seats under his leadership but not with the name of another person," Shivakumar added.

298.title: Use of sub-conventional aerial platforms banned in Delhi ahead of I-Day
298.article_body: Delhi Police have banned flying sub-conventional aerial platforms in the national capital from July 22 to August 16 ahead of Independence Day celebrations. The order bans the use of para-gliders, para-motors, hang-gliders, remotely piloted aircraft, hot air balloons, etc. Anti-social elements or terrorists may pose a threat to citizens' safety by the use of these platforms, police said.

299.title: Woman hires bouncers to abduct her lover in Mumbai for refusing to pay ₹5 lakh
299.article_body: A woman abducted her businessman "lover" in Mumbai by hiring two bouncers after he refused to pay ₹5 lakh demanded by her, police said. The accused allegedly assaulted the victim before abducting and confining him in a Thane-based flat. The victim, a resident of Dombivali, was in a relationship with the woman and used to pay her regularly, police added.

300.title: Eagerly waiting to see how Hindi audience will receive me: Naga on 'Laal...'
300.article_body: Naga Chaitanya, who'll be making his Bollywood debut with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said he's eagerly waiting to see how the Hindi audience will receive him. "I'll...work in Bollywood only if I get acceptance there," he added. Sharing his experience of working with Aamir, Naga said, "It's a dream come true to work with Aamir. He's a wonderful mentor."

301.title: We had confidence Siraj could defend 15 runs in last over: Chahal on 1st ODI
301.article_body: After India won the first ODI against West Indies by three runs in Port of Spain, India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said that the team had confidence that Mohammed Siraj could defend 15 runs in the final over. India scored 308/7 and West Indies managed 305/6 in 50 overs. Siraj posted bowling figures of 10-0-57-2. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

302.title: Man who set ex-wife afire during live stream executed in China
302.article_body: A court in China's Sichuan province on Saturday morning executed a man who was convicted of homicide for setting his former wife on fire. Tang Lu set his ex-wife, Tibetan vlogger Lhamo, on fire on September 14, 2020, when she was live-streaming on Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok. The 30-year-old woman died of her injuries a few weeks later.

303.title: US exploring whether it can send US-made jets to Ukraine: Official
303.article_body: White House spokesman John Kirby on Friday said that the US is exploring whether it can send US-made fighter jets to Ukraine. "It's not something that would be executed in the near-term," he added. Such a move would be a major increase in US support for Ukraine in its battle against Russia, according to Reuters.

304.title: BJP workers protest outside Sisodia's residence against new Liquor Policy
304.article_body: Delhi BJP leaders and workers on Saturday protested outside the residence of Deputy CM Manish Sisodia against the new Liquor Policy of the AAP government. The protesters were detained by police. This comes after Delhi LG VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into the alleged violation of the Delhi Excise Policy. Sisodia allegedly made "deliberate and gross procedural lapses".

305.title: People who criticise the govt will be punished: Taliban in new order
305.article_body: Taliban has issued a new order saying that those who criticise "Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan" scholars and public servants, be it with gesture, word or anything else, will be punished. In the order, Taliban leader Mullah Hibatullah Akhundzada said that such actions are considered as "negative propaganda" that "unconsciously helps the enemies".

306.title: Farmers, students protest in B'luru against land acquisition in Devanahalli
306.article_body: The All India Students' Association (AISA) and Fridays For Future (FFF) protested in Bengaluru against the government's plan of acquiring 1,777 acres of fertile agricultural land in Devanahalli. According to reports, about 387 families will be rendered landless if the plan goes ahead. "Industries can be set up on barren land, why is...government after fertile lands?" a student activist said.

307.title: We spend sleepless nights rethinking our verdicts: Chief Justice of India
307.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana has talked about "the responsibility of judging", which he said is "extremely burdensome" and takes a "toll on our mental well-being". He said, "Every litigant enters the courtroom with the expectation of obtaining justice." He added, "We spend sleepless nights rethinking our decisions."

308.title: Wanted to join active politics, but destiny had other plans: CJI Ramana
308.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana on Saturday revealed that he was keen on joining active politics but destiny had other plans for him. Speaking at an event, he said, "I was born in a village into an agricultural family and English was introduced in Class 7. After BSc, my father encouraged me to study law."

309.title: I hate watching myself on screen, I don't like anything about it: Disha
309.article_body: Actress Disha Patani said in an interview that she "hates" watching herself on screen. "I don't like watching myself. I can't watch myself...I don't like anything about it," she added. Disha further said whenever she watches her films, she covers her eyes most of the time. Disha will next be seen in 'Ek Villain Returns'.

310.title: Cross-voting in Bihar shows resentment in Oppn: BJP MP on Prez polls
310.article_body: Bihar BJP President and Lok Sabha MP Dr Sanjay Jaiswal said that there is evidence of cross-voting on a "substantial scale" during the Presidential elections in the state. He added that NDA's nominee Droupadi Murmu received 133 votes from the state, while their "effective strength...was 125". He claimed that this shows resentment in the Opposition against their leader.

311.title: 3D printing facility now operational at Airport City in Bengaluru
311.article_body: A state-of-the-art 3D printing facility is now operational at the Airport City that is being developed in Bengaluru Airport premises. "This facility will act as a catalyst to help transform our Airport City into a technology hub," Bengaluru Airport City Limited CEO said. "3D printing helps develop a culture of creativity and scope for scaling innovation across industries," he added.

312.title: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan had collapsed while playing cricket
312.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan, who passed away on Saturday morning, had collapsed while playing cricket. "He went to play cricket with his friends in the morning and collapsed on the ground," his co-star Shubhangi Atre told ETimes. He was rushed to a nearby hospital where he was declared dead.

313.title: Mohammad Shami buys Jaguar F-Type sports car worth nearly ₹1 crore, pic surfaces
313.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami has purchased a Jaguar F-Type sports car, which is worth nearly ₹1 crore. Shami's car is the 2.0 Coupe R-Dynamic variant. The car has a 2.0-litre turbocharged petrol engine. In June, Shami had bought a new Royal Enfield Continental GT 650 worth more than ₹3 crore.

314.title: I don't agree, my knees are already gone: Chahal on if cricket should be played in shorts
314.article_body: On being asked whether cricket should be played wearing shorts due to hot weather, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said, "No, no. I don't agree with that." He added, "We have to take care of our knees whenever we slide, it's very hard. My two knees are already gone, there are many bruises. I think full pants work well for us."

315.title: Heatwave kills over 1,700 people in Spain and Portugal
315.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Europe has claimed over 1,700 lives in Portugal and Spain alone, the World Health Organization's European office said. The agency believes the figure would "increase further over the coming days". "Climate change is not new. Its consequences, however, are mounting season after season, year after year, with disastrous outcomes," WHO Europe office Director Hans Kluge said.

316.title: Chhattisgarh to start process to recruit 10,000 school teachers: CM Baghel
316.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has announced that the state government will soon start the process of recruiting "10,000 new teachers" for its schools. "Since 1998, the state government has recruited 14,000 teachers so far," CM Baghel said. He also added that 163 mobile veterinary units would be rolled out soon for the treatment of animals in the state.

317.title: I'm vacating Shikaripura seat, son Vijayendra will contest: Yediyurappa
317.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and BJP leader BS Yediyurappa said on Friday that he will be vacating his Shikaripura constituency seat and won't contest the next Assembly election. He added that his son Vijayendra will contest from the constituency. He also urged people to make sure that Vijayendra wins with a margin "bigger" than his own.

318.title: BJP MP writes to Scindia seeking more int'l flights from Pune
318.article_body: BJP MP from Pune Girish Bapat has written a letter to Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, saying that people have approached him to ask civil aviation authority to start international flights from the city to Singapore, Bangkok, East Asia, Europe and America. "I'll be thankful...if you'll kindly instruct...civil aviation authority to start more international flights from Pune," he said.

319.title: 2 persons test positive for BA.5 sub-variant of Omicron in Pune
319.article_body: Two persons in Pune have tested positive for the BA.5 sub-variant of the Omicron COVID-19 variant, the Maharashtra Public Health Department informed. The samples of both patients were sent to National Institute of Virology (NIV) in Pune. The patients tested positive for COVID-19 during routine screening at Pune Airport, between July 3 and 9, while they were returning from Dubai.

320.title: 2 killed, 1 injured as building collapses due to heavy rains in T'gana
320.article_body: Two people died and one was injured after a building collapsed due to heavy rains in Telangana's Warangal district on Saturday. The incident occurred when the debris from the building fell on the adjacent hut where the victims were staying. The deceased were identified as Tippa Rao and Feroze, whereas a woman named Saleema suffered serious injuries in the incident.

321.title: CCI can't probe Facebook just because it owns WhatsApp: Meta tells HC
321.article_body: Meta on Friday opposed the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) investigation into Facebook in relation to WhatsApp's privacy policy in the Delhi High Court. "The fact that one owns the other...WhatsApp would share something with me is no ground to commence investigation," Meta's lawyer said. "The ownership is common but roads are different, policies are different," the lawyer further said.

322.title: Will give more than 10% of my salary: Guj policeman adopts 100 children
322.article_body: A Sub-inspector in Gujarat Police, Hareshbhai L Jabaliya, has adopted 100 children from government school in a village in Dhari. "I adopted 100 students of 1st to 8th standard of government school, and now I am taking charge of their education," Jabaliya said. He added that right now, he will give more than 10% of his salary towards the effort.

323.title: Couldn't have imagined Nadal, Djokovic, Federer, Murray in 1 team: Borg
323.article_body: With Rafael Nadal, Roger Federer, Novak Djokovic and Andy Murray set to represent Team Europe in Laver Cup 2022, Team Europe captain and six-time French Open champion Bjorn Borg said he couldn't have imagined them together. "I like our chances," added Borg. Djokovic termed Nadal, Federer and Murray as three of his "biggest all-time" rivals, adding it'll be "truly unique".

324.title: Fake doctor working in private hospital arrested in Hyderabad
324.article_body: Police arrested a 36-year-old man for allegedly impersonating a doctor at a private hospital in Hyderabad. The accused, identified as Kudiletti Vijay Kumar, reportedly acquired fake MBBS certificates affiliated to a Russian university for about ₹6.5 lakh and worked at a hospital in Uppal for six months during the COVID-19 pandemic. He later joined a hospital in Meerpet.

325.title: 3 minor sisters, aged 6-9 years, drown in pond in Madhya Pradesh
325.article_body: Three minor sisters drowned in a pond located in Khatami village in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district. The deceased, Asha (6), Kundi (8) and Gundi (9), were daughters of Inam Singh and had drowned while playing in the pond, police said. The deceased's parents got to know about the incident when they were working at an agricultural farm, police added.

326.title: Kallakurichi student's body handed over to parents, last rites held
326.article_body: The body of the 12th class student who allegedly died by suicide after alleging harassment at a Kallakurichi school in Tamil Nadu was handed over to her parents on Saturday. The family of the deceased girl mourned her loss as her body reached her native village in the city. Reports said that the last rites were conducted amid tight security.

327.title: Delhi to start 'Spoken English' course for those who lack communication skills
327.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that the AAP government is starting a 'Spoken English' course for youngsters belonging to poor and middle-class families who lack communication skills. "The Delhi Skill and Entrepreneurship University would be running this course," he added. "In the next year...we will train one lakh students in spoken English at 50 centres," Kejriwal stated.

328.title: 65-yr-old Mindtree Co-founder Subroto Bagchi to complete his DU degree 40 yrs later
328.article_body: With Delhi University permitting former students to complete their degree exams as part of its centenary programme, 65-year-old Subroto Bagchi, Co-founder of Mindtree, tweeted he is a "student again" and will complete his only "unfinished task". Bagchi said that he was enrolled in the Law Faculty in 1978 but couldn’t complete his degree as he had to leave Delhi.

329.title: Dedicate this to my kids, family: Suriya on National Award
329.article_body: Suriya, who won the National Award for Best Actor for 'Soorarai Pottru', has penned a note thanking his fans for their love and good wishes. "I dedicate this award to my kids Diya, Dev and...my loving family," he wrote. "The overwhelming reception for our film, which was released...on OTT during...pandemic, has made our eyes well up in joy," Suriya added.

330.title: CISF personnel shoots self dead at Kolkata airport's staff toilet
330.article_body: A CISF personnel allegedly shot himself dead at a staff toilet in the basement at Kolkata's Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport, police said. The deceased's body, which has been sent for post-mortem examination, was found on Friday after airport security personnel rushed to the toilet on hearing a gunshot, police added. A case of unnatural death has been registered.

331.title: Russo Brothers in talks with Farhan, Ritesh Sidhwani for a collaboration
331.article_body: 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Anthony Russo and Joe Russo are in early talks with Farhan Akhtar and Ritesh Sidhwani, the owners of Excel Entertainment, for a collaboration. "At this moment, I can only say that it's an exchange of ideas at this stage," Anthony said. Anthony added that Farhan and Ritesh have a "brilliant knack for telling disruptive stories".

332.title: Want guys to take risks; continue playing in the fashion we want: Buttler
332.article_body: After winning the second ODI against South Africa on Friday, England ODI skipper Jos Buttler has said that he wants his players "to back themselves and take risks". "It's paramount [that] guys continue to try and play in the fashion we want to as a team," Buttler said. "We're trying to put pressure back on them (opposition)," he added.

333.title: Thai PM survives 4th no-confidence vote in Parliament
333.article_body: Thai Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha and 10 cabinet ministers on Saturday survived no-confidence votes in Parliament. The 68-year-old former army chief received 256 votes in favour and 206 against with nine abstentions, securing his place as PM until his term ends in March next year. It was the fourth time Prayut's performance had been put to a vote since 2019.

334.title: Media running kangaroo courts, ill-informed debates detrimental to democracy: CJI
334.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has said, "Of late, we see media running kangaroo courts, at times on issues even experienced judges find difficult to decide." "Ill-informed and agenda driven debates on issues involving justice delivery are proving to be detrimental to health of democracy," he added. "Print media still has a certain degree of accountability," he further said.

335.title: NDA stands for 'No Data Available': Rahul criticises govt over lack of data
335.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led NDA government for allegedly not having data on various points. "No Data Available [NDA] government wants you to believe [that]...no one died of oxygen shortage...no farmer died protesting...no migrant died walking...no one was mob lynched...no journalist has been arrested," Rahul tweeted. He also shared a GIF, which said, "Sab Gayab Si."

336.title: Yasin Malik begins hunger strike in Tihar jail over fair trial
336.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik has begun a hunger strike in Tihar jail, demanding a fair trial in his case, prison officials said on Saturday. Malik, the chief of banned Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front, is serving a life sentence in a terror funding case. He'd moved an application to the Central government requesting a physical hearing in two cases.

337.title: Kapiva's Dr Anand recommends Hair Care Juice to reduce hair loss
337.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims that 93% of Hair Care Juice users observed a reduction in hair fall while 72% observed an increased hair growth. Dr Anand, Ayurvedacharya at Kapiva shared that inner nutrition with ingredients like Noni, Bhringraj, Ashwagandha, and Amla stimulates the scalp's bloodstream, replaces dead cells in hair follicles, combats breakage and hair loss due to stress.

338.title: Auto driver gets 20-year jail for sexually assaulting minor girl in Kerala
338.article_body: A 42-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was sentenced to 20 years in prison by a court in Kerala's Kottayam for sexually assaulting a minor girl over a period of one year. The court also imposed a fine of ₹2 lakh on the man. The convict, Sebi, used to abuse the child while dropping her home from school.

339.title: Talk that Kohli should be replaced is too premature: Ajit Agarkar
339.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said there is a lot of talk that Virat Kohli should be replaced, terming it as "too premature". "There are other players who are performing well but that doesn't mean you have to start questioning Kohli," added Agarkar. India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev had suggested that Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side.

340.title: Adani adds more wealth than anyone else, gets richer by $36 billion this year
340.article_body: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani has added nearly $36 billion to his wealth this year, more than anyone else among the world's 500 richest people, as per Bloomberg. Adani recently overtook Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a net worth of $112 billion. Notably, Adani recently pledged $7.7 billion to charity to mark his 60th birthday.

341.title: No physical classes for kids under 12 in Manipur over COVID-19
341.article_body: Amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in the state, the Manipur government on Friday said physical classes for children below 12 years or up to Class 7 till August 7 will not be allowed. It added that Classes 8 and above will be allowed to reopen from July 25 while observing COVID-appropriate behaviour and adhering to government's guidelines.

342.title: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan passes away
342.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' actor Deepesh Bhan has passed away. Reacting to the news of his death, actress Kavita Kaushik wrote, "In shock, gutted, pained...Was a fit guy who never drank/smoked or did anything to harm his health." His co-actor Charrul Malik said, "I can't believe it still...I just met him yesterday and he was all fine."

343.title: 3 Kerala policemen suspended after man dies upon release from custody
343.article_body: A sub-inspector, an assistant sub-inspector and a civil police officer were suspended in Kerala's Kozhikode following the death of a 42-year-old man upon his release from police custody. The deceased's relatives alleged that the police had brutally beaten the man. "A report prima facie suggests there were lapses on behalf of the policemen," a police official said.

344.title: England's Jonathan Trott appointed head coach of Afghanistan
344.article_body: Former England batter Jonathan Trott has been appointed as the new head coach of the Afghanistan men's cricket team. Trott will be replacing former English cricketer Graham Thorpe and will join during Afghanistan's tour to Ireland next month, the Afghanistan Cricket Board said. "I'm...excited to have the opportunity to take one of international cricket's most exciting teams," Trott said.

345.title: Waiter stabs cook to death at a 3-star hotel in Mumbai
345.article_body: A waiter allegedly stabbed a cook to death at a 3-star hotel in Andheri East in Mumbai. The accused, Madhav Mandal (27), had an argument with the deceased, Jagdish Jalal (42), over a customer's order at midnight and after losing his temper, Mandal killed Jalal at around 8 am, police said. Notably, Mandal is a resident of Bhayandar, Mumbai.

346.title: 30-yr-old gang-raped by 2 railway employees inside Delhi railway station's staff room
346.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by two railway employees inside the electrical maintenance staff room of a railway station in Delhi on Thursday.
