An FIR of gang-rape has been registered and four railway employees, including two who guarded the room from outside. All four accused were arrested within two hours of an FIR being registered.

347.title: If Rajiv was here, I'd have given him something: Randhir on National Award
347.article_body: Randhir Kapoor has said he's very happy for his late actor-brother Rajiv Kapoor whose 'Toolsidas Junior' won the National Award for Best Hindi Film. "If he was there, I would have given him something," Randhir added. "I am very happy. It's a very good picture. He has acted very well in the film. I am delighted," he further said.

348.title: BSF opens fire at suspected Pakistani drone in Jammu; search launched
348.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) opened fire at a suspected Pakistani drone along the international border in Jammu on Friday night, a senior official said. The incident occurred when the BSF troops noticed a blinking red light coming from the Pakistani side. The troops then immediately opened fire at the drone and later launched a search operation in the area.

349.title: Poland to buy jets, tanks and howitzers from South Korea
349.article_body: Polish Defence Minister Mariusz Blaszczak has said that the country will buy 180 K2 "Black Panther" tanks, 48 FA-50 fighter planes and an undefined number of K9 howitzers from South Korea. "We're signing contracts next week," he added. Poland, a NATO member bordering Ukraine, is boosting its defence capabilities in a bid to counter a possible threat from Russia.

350.title: Punjab CM’s residence in Chandigarh fined ₹10,000 after complaints of littering
350.article_body: The Chandigarh Municipal Corporation has imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on Punjab Chief Minister residence in Chandigarh's Sector 2 after complaints of littering by staff and visitors since last year. "Chief Minister is supposed to set good example for the state to follow but...here his own official house is not in order," local BJP Councillor Mahesh Inder Singh Sidhu said.

351.title: Musk is doing his best to run us down, it’s attempted sabotage: Twitter
351.article_body: Twitter's attorney argued that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "doing his best to run Twitter down" after he terminated the $44 billion deal. William Savitt said, "It’s attempted sabotage." Musk's attorney Andrew Rossman replied, the Tesla CEO has "no interest in damaging the company" and is Twitter’s second-largest shareholder with a "far larger stake" than its entire board of directors.

352.title: Man killed after truck runs over him in Delhi's Geeta Colony
352.article_body: A 55-year-old man died after a truck ran over him near the SDM office in Geeta Colony, Delhi, on Thursday. The deceased, Pradeep Kumar, worked as a typist at the SDM office and was a resident of Delhi's Gandhi Nagar area. Notably, the unidentified suspected driver is absconding while a truck with Haryana's registration number has been seized, police said.

353.title: Mega block to affect services on Santacruz-Goregaon fast lines on July 24
353.article_body: Services on fast lines between Santacruz and Goregaon will remain affected for five hours on July 24 from 10 am to 3 pm as the Railways will be undertaking a mega block. Maintenance work of tracks, signalling and overhead equipment on fast lines will be carried out. During this period, suburban services will run on slow lines between these stations.

354.title: Over 28,000 Indians waiting to adopt child, trend not declining: Govt
354.article_body: About 28,663 Indians are waiting to adopt a child in the country, the government said on Friday, and noted that the number of adoptions is not declining. While responding to a question in Lok Sabha, Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani informed that 1,030 foreign applicants are registered with Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA) for adoption.

355.title: Submit documents to prove majority in Shiv Sena: ECI to Shinde, Thackeray
355.article_body: The Election Commission of India has asked Uddhav Thackeray and Eknath Shinde to submit documentary evidence to prove their majority numbers in Shiv Sena. Thackeray and Shinde have been directed to submit written statements by 1 pm on August 8. "Both the groups claim to be the real Shiv Sena with their leader being the alleged Sena president," ECI stated.

356.title: If someone spent 10-15 days with Raj, they don't have to be assistant: Anees
356.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said late actor Raj Kapoor was institute and if someone spent 10-15 days with him, they don't have to be assistant. "I was assistant with Jainendra Jain...[in] Prem Rog but due to some reasons...he couldn't do it so Raj Kapoor sir stepped in...it was my luck and then I worked with him for three-four years," he added.

357.title: He was Tanhaji in the truest form: Om Raut on Ajay's National Award
357.article_body: Director Om Raut in an interview congratulated Ajay Devgn for winning the Best Actor National Award for 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior', saying, "He was Tanhaji in the truest form." He added that the film had the "wholehearted support of Ajay Devgn sir, who not only agreed to play the lead but also took the efforts to produce it".

358.title: Putin congratulates President-elect Droupadi Murmu
358.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has congratulated President-elect Droupadi Murmu. In a statement, Putin said, "We attach much importance to the relations of special privileged strategic partnership with India. I hope your activities as the head of state will promote the further development of the Russian-Indian political dialogue and productive cooperation in different areas."

359.title: Best cover shot India has seen: Masaba on Ranveer's nude photoshoot
359.article_body: Reacting to actor Ranveer Singh posing nude, former Windies captain Viv Richards and actress Neena Gupta's daughter Masaba Gupta termed it on Instagram as the "best cover shot" India has seen. "Brave & unapologetic," added Masaba, while commenting on Ranveer's post. "It's so easy...to be physically naked...I can be naked in front of a thousand people," Ranveer had said.

360.title: UP thief being brought to Mumbai jumps off train to escape police; dies
360.article_body: A 30-year-old man arrested from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly committing theft in Mumbai died after jumping off a train near Manmad to escape police. He perhaps thought the train had slowed down, police said. He was being brought to Mumbai. The deceased had recently broken into an imitation jewellery shop in Kandivali and stole copper plates worth a few lakhs.

361.title: Satellite pics show water level at US' largest reservoir at its lowest since 1937
361.article_body: Satellite pictures shared by NASA show water levels in Lake Mead, the largest reservoir in the US, at the lowest since it was filled in April 1937. At its maximum capacity, Lake Mead can hold 36 trillion litre of water and it last approached full capacity in 1983 and 1999. It is currently filled to just 27% of its capacity.

362.title: No ceasefire without recovering land lost to Russia: Ukraine Prez
362.article_body: A ceasefire with Russia without reclaiming lost territories would only prolong the war, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in an interview with The Wall Street Journal. "We'd prefer to de-occupy in a way that's not military and to save lives...But we're dealing with who we're dealing with. Until they get smashed in the face, they won't understand anything," he added.

363.title: Musk’s team underestimated court's ability: Judge as it sets Oct trial for Twitter case
363.article_body: A Delaware judge while ruling that Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion deal will be held in October, said his team underestimated the "court’s ability to quickly process complex litigation". Chancellor Kathaleen St. Jude McCormick added, "Delay threatens irreparable harm." Musk’s team while opposing Twitter's expedited trial bid, suggested it be held next year.

364.title: BBMP suspends 2 engineers as roads built before PM's visit wear out
364.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Friday suspended two engineers after roads constructed ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit on June 20 started to peel off. The civic body had revealed that ₹23 crore was spent to redevelop and repair about 14 km of roads, which wore out within 15 days of construction.

365.title: No decision yet on implementation of Uniform Civil Code in country: Rijiju
365.article_body: The Centre on Friday said that it has not yet taken any decision on the implementation of Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the country. "There are some writ petitions pending in the Hon'ble Supreme Court...regarding UCC. Since the matter is sub-judice, no decision on implementation of UCC...has been taken as of now," Union Minister Kiren Rijiju informed the Lok Sabha.

366.title: Feels like a win, everyone saw what we're capable of: Pooran on 1st ODI
366.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said his team's defeat by three runs in the first ODI against India "feels like" a win. "Bittersweet...but...everyone saw what we are capable of and hopefully we can go strength to strength from here," added Pooran. "It's difficult to lose but we will take this one," he stated. The second ODI will be played tomorrow.

367.title: Didn't expect them to come this close: Dhawan on 3-run win vs WI
367.article_body: Discussing India's win by three runs in the first ODI against West Indies, India's stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan said they didn't expect West Indies to come this close. "We had nerves...We have to get better," added Dhawan. "We gave doubles to fine leg. One of them should have been a run-out," he stated. Dhawan was the top run-getter scoring 97(99).

368.title: Maha makes fire evacuation lifts mandatory for high-rises equal to or above 70 metres
368.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Department has mandated that all high-rise buildings equal to or above 70 metres (22 floors) across the state should have Fire Evacuation Lifts (FELs). "Evacuation process happens faster through lifts when compared to staircases," Mumbai Fire Brigade chief fire officer said. Notably, only 13 high-rises out of 368 skyscrapers in Mumbai are equipped with FELs.

369.title: Principal's 20-yr-old son sexually assaults 9-yr-old student in Hyd
369.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested on Friday for allegedly sexually assaulting a nine-year-old female student in a room on the terrace of a private school in Hyderabad's Moin Bagh. The accused is the son of the school's principal. A case was filed under sections of the Indian Penal Code and the POCSO Act after the girl's parents filed a complaint.

370.title: Bengaluru Metro becomes first in India to conduct 5G network trials
370.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) on Friday said it has become the first Metro in India to test 5G network. The 5G network, deployed at MG Road station, was tested under a pilot project of TRAI (Telecom Regulatory Authority of India). It gave a download speed of 1.4 Gbps and an upload speed of 65 Mbps, BMRCL tweeted.

371.title: $130 billion wiped off social media companies' market value in a day
371.article_body: American social media companies lost more than $130 billion from their combined stock market value on Friday. The wipeout comes after Twitter and Snap's quarterly results raised concerns about the outlook for online advertising. Shares of Snap fell 39% to its lowest level since March 2020, whereas Alphabet stock declined 5.6% in its biggest one-day drop in over 2 years.

372.title: Woman lay dead in UK flat for over 2 years; landlord kept taking rent
372.article_body: A landlord in the UK cut off gas and kept taking rent from a tenant as she lay dead in the flat for over two years. The remains of the woman, Sheila Seleoane, were found in February. She had to be identified by dental records after her skeletal remains were found on the sofa in the living room.

373.title: People haven't lost faith in MVA, they're disgusted by dirty politics: Aaditya
373.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray has said that the people haven't lost faith in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA), rather they're "disgusted with the dirty politics of greed" displayed by the rebel party leaders. He also blamed the "greed of traitors" for the split in the party, adding, "The other blame may be is on us, for trusting too much."

374.title: Hotel manager puts liquor sale ad outside Pune university, held
374.article_body: Pune police have arrested a hotel manager based on a Facebook post by an advocate alleging that the hotel had put up an advertisement for the sale of liquor outside a private university. The advertisement, stating- "unlimited liquor for two hours for ₹799", was put up despite a liquor sale ban within 100 metres of an educational institution's entrance.

375.title: Feels like I've done something good: 'Soorarai...' maker on National Award win
375.article_body: Director Sudha Kongara, whose 'Soorarai Pottru' won multiple awards at the 68th National Film Awards, said, "I feel fantastic that a mainstream film is getting...National Award." "It feels damn good and feels like I've done something good," she added. 'Soorarai Pottru' was awarded in the Best Feature Film, Best Screenplay and Best Music Direction (Background Music) categories.

376.title: Attackers beat Raj Sikh Granthi, talk of cutting neck; put chilli in eyes
376.article_body: Unidentified attackers beat up a Sikh Granthi in Rajasthan's Alwar, reports said. A report that was filed with police said that the attackers were talking of cutting off the Granthi's neck. The victim reportedly said that the attackers cut off his hair. Reports added that they also put chilli powder in the victim's eyes.

377.title: People tell me 'you started a makeup company because you look bad': Vineeta Singh
377.article_body: SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh, speaking about facing online trolls, said, "I'm the CEO of a company...even now, people are...commenting things like...'You started a makeup company because you look so bad'." The Shark Tank India judge added, "I've achieved so much in life, but when I post something [on Instagram], 95% of the comments are about the way [I] look."

378.title: Russia claims it destroyed 4 US-made HIMARS launchers in Ukraine
378.article_body: The Russian Defence Ministry on Friday said that its forces have destroyed four US-made High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) in Ukraine. The "four launchers and one reloading vehicle for the HIMARS were destroyed" between July 5-20, the ministry added. Ukraine has rejected Moscow's claims, calling them "fakes" designed to undermine the West's support for the country.

379.title: So happy and proud: Kajol as 'Tanhaji...' wins 3 National Awards
379.article_body: After her film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' won three National Awards, Kajol wrote on Instagram, "So happy and proud." The Om Raut directorial won the National Awards for Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment and Best Costume Design. Ajay Devgn was awarded the Best Actor for his performance in the film. Kajol played the role of Savitribai Malusare.

380.title: West Bengal minister Partha arrested by ED after ₹20 crore cash found at aide's home
380.article_body: West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with an alleged teacher recruitment scam. The ED on Friday recovered ₹20 crore in cash from the house of an aide of Chatterjee. "The said amount is suspected to be proceeds of crime of the said SSC scam," the probe agency had said.

381.title: I like getting kicked in matches: Manchester City's Jack Grealish
381.article_body: Manchester City's Jack Grealish, who's the most expensive Premier League footballer, said he "likes" getting kicked by opponents during matches. "It gets me going...I get it at a lot of places," added Grealish. Grealish joined City from Aston Villa for £100 million. Talking about Grealish, ex-Aston Villa manager Tim Sherwood earlier said he hadn't seen anyone get kicked so much.

382.title: 79-yr-old Ashok Soota launches his 3rd startup, aims to take it to IPO in 5 yrs
382.article_body: Entrepreneur Ashok Soota, 79, has launched his latest venture Happiest Health, which he aims to take to IPO in five years. Soota worked at Wipro from 1985 to 1999, after which he quit and co-founded rival company Mindtree Limited, bringing it to an IPO in 2007. He then founded Happiest Minds Technologies in 2011, which had its IPO in 2020.

383.title: Trump's former advisor found guilty of contempt of Congress
383.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-advisor Steve Bannon was convicted on Friday of contempt of Congress for defying a congressional subpoena from the US House committee probing the Capitol riot. Bannon was found guilty of refusing to appear for a deposition and refusing to provide documents in response to the committee's subpoena. He faces up to two years in jail.

384.title: 2 brothers beaten up in Delhi’s Shahdara for objecting to drinking in public
384.article_body: A 25-year-old man and his brother were allegedly beaten up in Delhi's Shahdara for objecting to a man drinking and smoking outside a public toilet. Police have arrested two persons named Shahrukh and Aamir. The incident took place on Wednesday night when Danish, who sells lemons in the market, asked Shahrukh not to drink in open, leading to an argument.

385.title: Bihar man asks for ₹600 he lent, dies after head smashed on road
385.article_body: A man from Bihar, Bharat Shah, died after his head was allegedly smashed on the road after he asked to be returned ₹600 that he lent to a man. Bharat had lent ₹600 to a man, Mohammad Faizal, to book a train ticket in May this year. Fight broke out between them when Shah went to ask for his money.

386.title: Govt has no data on Anganwadi workers who died due to COVID-19: Irani
386.article_body: Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani informed the Lok Sabha on Friday that the government has no data on the number of Anganwadi workers who died due to COVID-19. "As Anganwadi services is a scheme implemented by states/UTs, the data on the number of Anganwadi workers who died due to coronavirus is not available with this ministry," Irani added.

387.title: AAP to contest all wards in B'luru civic polls, invites candidates
387.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party Karnataka chief Prithvi Reddy on Friday said that the party will contest polls in all wards of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). "As a part of the 'One Chance to Kejriwal' campaign, a Candidate Search Committee has been formed," Reddy said. We invite people from different walks of life to fight elections, he added.

388.title: Active COVID-19 cases in India cross 1,50,000 mark
388.article_body: Active COVID-19 cases in India have crossed the 1,50,000 mark as the country reported 21,411 cases and 67 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 21,880 COVID-19 cases. The number of COVID-19 deaths in the country has risen to 5,25,997.

389.title: Bengaluru reports 1,244 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
389.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,244 new COVID-19 cases and 996 recoveries, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Friday. The number of active cases was 7,355, while the infection positivity rate stood at 6.63%. No deaths were reported in this period. Nearly two crore vaccines have been administered so far in the city.

390.title: Rachakonda Police bust human trafficking racket, 2 women rescued
390.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Friday said that they have busted an inter-state human trafficking racket and arrested six persons. Police also rescued two Bangladeshi sisters, including a 15-year-old girl, during the operation. According to police, the accused had links to Jharkhand, Maharashtra and Rajasthan and smuggled young girls from Bangladesh and other parts of the country into the city.

391.title: Man sucked to his death as sinkhole opens under swimming pool during party in Israel
391.article_body: A man was sucked to his death after a sinkhole opened under a swimming pool he was in at a house party in Israel. The incident happened at a villa which was hosting a company event in the central town of Karmi Yosef. The victim has been identified as a 32-year-old employee of the company.

392.title: That run-out was too casual: Agarkar on Gill's dismissal in 1st ODI
392.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar said Shubman Gill's dismissal after getting run-out in the first ODI against West Indies was "too casual". "That (run-out) is the one thing you don't want to do. Shikhar Dhawan is probably going to teach him today, that once you get a start, don't...give it away," added Agarkar. Gill scored 64 runs in 53 balls.

393.title: May shift business from Zomato, Swiggy if commissions rise: Domino's
393.article_body: Jubilant FoodWorks, which runs the Domino's and Dunkin' Donuts chain in India, has said that it will consider taking some of its business away from Zomato and Swiggy, if their commissions rise further. The company was responding to the Competition Commission of India, which is investigating the alleged anti-competitive practices of Zomato and Swiggy.

394.title: Body of 50-year-old man found stuffed in fridge in Delhi, probe on
394.article_body: An investigation was launched after the body of a 50-year-old man was found stuffed in a refrigerator in his house in Northeast Delhi's Seelampur. Primary inquiry said that the man lived alone in the house and his wife and children lived separately at a distance. Police said that a caller informed them that her relative was not attending calls.

395.title: Ghaziabad man stabs wife to death following an argument
395.article_body: A 40-year-old man stabbed his wife to death following an argument in Sector 15, Vasundhara in Ghaziabad. Later, the accused, Vikas Meena, jumped off the building's top floor and sustained a fracture, police said. Vikas' father, Jagdish, claimed that his son suspected that the deceased, Kamini (35), was having an extramarital affair. Notably, Vikas is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

396.title: SC stays HC order refusing to dismiss corruption case against Yediyurappa
396.article_body: Supreme Court granted an interim stay on Karnataka HC order refusing to dismiss corruption charges against former CM BS Yediyurappa in connection with an illegal land denotification case of 2006-07. Yediyurappa's counsel said the probe against him was an abuse of the judicial process. Yediyurappa had "misused his official powers in facilitating large-scale misuse of land", as per the complainant.

397.title: Delhi Police beat us, touched inappropriately in Dwarka: Transpersons
397.article_body: A group of transpersons alleged that they were beaten up mercilessly with sticks and one of them was touched inappropriately by Delhi Police at Dwarka's Dabri Police Station. They alleged police took a person from the shelter home who they said was reported missing by parents and sent the person away. When they objected, they were reportedly assaulted.

398.title: Suspecting stay with another man, Maha man stabs wife 10-12 times; kills her
398.article_body: Suspecting that his wife was staying with another man, a man from Navi Mumbai's Vashi stabbed his wife to death on Friday. Reports said that he stabbed his wife 10-12 times. The accused allegedly also attacked his friend and a pedestrian, both of whom tried to stop him. The accused injured himself too and is admitted to hospital currently.

399.title: Ukraine has around $10 bn worth of grain available for sale: Zelenskyy
399.article_body: After Ukraine and Russia sealed a deal with Turkey and UN to restart the export of Ukrainian grains, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine has around $10 billion worth of grain available for sale. "This is another demonstration that Ukraine can withstand...war," he added. The Russian military's blockade of Ukrainian ports had halted grain exports, causing a global food crisis.

400.title: Fruits worth lakhs damaged, washed away due to heavy rains in Hyd
400.article_body: Fruits worth lakhs of rupees were damaged in Hyderabad's Batasingaram fruit market on Friday as the city witnessed heavy rains. A lot of sweet limes, pomegranates, apples and other fruits were washed away as rainwater collected in the market, according to traders. Following this, authorities put up a shed at the market as it was shifted to a safer location.

401.title: 44-yr-old lawyer shoots himself to death in Hyderabad
401.article_body: A 44-year-old lawyer allegedly shot himself dead at his residence in Hyderabad's Bagh Lingampally area on Friday, police said. The deceased, identified as Shiva Reddy, had retired as sergeant from the Air Force and was currently practicing as an advocate. Shiva was a divorcee and lived alone, police said. He is suspected to have shot himself with his licensed pistol.
